Main article: [Mediterranean and Middle East theatre of World War II](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mediterranean_and_Middle_East_theatre_of_World_War_II "Mediterranean and Middle East theatre of World War II")

In early June 1940, the Italian _[Regia Aeronautica](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Regia\_Aeronautica "Regia Aeronautica")_[attacked and besieged Malta](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Siege_of_Malta_(World_War_II) "Siege of Malta (World War II)"), a British possession. From late summer to early autumn, Italy [conquered British Somaliland](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Italian_invasion_of_British_Somaliland "Italian invasion of British Somaliland") and made an [incursion into British-held Egypt](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Italian_invasion_of_Egypt "Italian invasion of Egypt"). In October, [Italy attacked Greece](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Greco-Italian_War "Greco-Italian War"), but the attack was repulsed with heavy Italian casualties; the campaign ended within months with minor territorial changes.[[118]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEClogg2002118-121) To assist Italy and prevent Britain from gaining a foothold, Germany prepared to invade the Balkans, which would threaten Romanian oil fields and strike against British dominance of the Mediterranean.[[119]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-122)

[![Image 28](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ea/Bundesarchiv_Bild_101I-783-0109-11%2C_Nordafrika%2C_Panzer_III_in_Fahrt.jpg/250px-Bundesarchiv_Bild_101I-783-0109-11%2C_Nordafrika%2C_Panzer_III_in_Fahrt.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Bundesarchiv_Bild_101I-783-0109-11,_Nordafrika,_Panzer_III_in_Fahrt.jpg)

German [Panzer III](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Panzer_III "Panzer III") of the [Afrika Korps](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Afrika_Korps "Afrika Korps") advancing across the North African desert, April 1941

In December 1940, British Empire forces began [counter-offensives](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Compass "Operation Compass") against Italian forces in Egypt and [Italian East Africa](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/East_African_campaign_(World_War_II) "East African campaign (World War II)").[[120]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEJowett20019%E2%80%9310-123) The offensives were successful; by early February 1941, Italy had lost control of eastern Libya, and large numbers of Italian troops had been taken prisoner. The [Italian Navy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Regia_Marina "Regia Marina") also suffered significant defeats, with the Royal Navy putting three Italian battleships out of commission after a [carrier attack at Taranto](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Taranto "Battle of Taranto"), and neutralising several more warships at the [Battle of Cape Matapan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Cape_Matapan "Battle of Cape Matapan").[[121]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEJackson2006106-124)

Italian defeats prompted Germany to [deploy an expeditionary force](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Sonnenblume "Operation Sonnenblume") to North Africa; at the end of March 1941, [Rommel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Erwin_Rommel "Erwin Rommel")'s [Afrika Korps](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Afrika_Korps "Afrika Korps")[launched an offensive](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Western_Desert_campaign "Western Desert campaign") which drove back Commonwealth forces.[[122]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTELaurier20017%E2%80%938-125) In less than a month, Axis forces advanced to western Egypt and [besieged the port of Tobruk](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Siege_of_Tobruk "Siege of Tobruk").[[123]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEMurrayMillett2001263%E2%80%93276-126)

By late March 1941, [Bulgaria](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tsardom_of_Bulgaria_(1908%E2%80%931946) "Tsardom of Bulgaria (1908–1946)") and [Yugoslavia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yugoslavia "Yugoslavia") signed the [Tripartite Pact](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tripartite_Pact "Tripartite Pact"); however, the Yugoslav government was [overthrown two days later](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yugoslav_coup_d%27%C3%A9tat "Yugoslav coup d'état") by pro-British nationalists. Germany and Italy responded with simultaneous invasions of both [Yugoslavia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Invasion_of_Yugoslavia "Invasion of Yugoslavia") and [Greece](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/German_invasion_of_Greece "German invasion of Greece"), commencing on 6 April 1941; both nations were forced to surrender within the month.[[124]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEGilbert1989174%E2%80%93175-127) The airborne [invasion of the Greek island of Crete](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Crete "Battle of Crete") at the end of May completed the German conquest of the Balkans.[[125]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEGilbert1989184%E2%80%93187-128) Partisan warfare subsequently broke out against the [Axis occupation of Yugoslavia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II_in_Yugoslavia "World War II in Yugoslavia"), which continued until the end of the war.[[126]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEGilbert1989208,_575,_604-129)

In the Middle East in May, Commonwealth forces [quashed an uprising in Iraq](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anglo-Iraqi_War "Anglo-Iraqi War") which had been supported by German aircraft from bases within Vichy-controlled [Syria](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mandate_for_Syria_and_the_Lebanon "Mandate for Syria and the Lebanon").[[127]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEWatson200380-130) Between June and July, British-led forces [invaded and occupied the French possessions of Syria and Lebanon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syria%E2%80%93Lebanon_campaign "Syria–Lebanon campaign"), assisted by the [Free French](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Free_France "Free France").[[128]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-131)

triples.sentence: In October, [Italy attacked Greece](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Greco-Italian_War "Greco-Italian War"), but the attack was repulsed with heavy Italian casualties; the campaign ended within months with minor territorial changes.[[118]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEClogg2002118-121)
triples.statement: In October, Italy's attack on Greece was repulsed with heavy Italian casualties, and the campaign concluded within months with only minor territorial changes.

triples.sentence: To assist Italy and prevent Britain from gaining a foothold, Germany prepared to invade the Balkans, which would threaten Romanian oil fields and strike against British dominance of the Mediterranean.[[119]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-122)
triples.statement: To aid Italy and counter British influence, Germany prepared to invade the Balkans, which would threaten Romanian oil fields and challenge British control of the Mediterranean.

triples.statement: In December 1940, British Empire forces initiated counter-offensives against Italian forces in Egypt and Italian East Africa.

triples.sentence: The [Italian Navy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Regia_Marina "Regia Marina") also suffered significant defeats, with the Royal Navy putting three Italian battleships out of commission after a [carrier attack at Taranto](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Taranto "Battle of Taranto"), and neutralising several more warships at the [Battle of Cape Matapan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Cape_Matapan "Battle of Cape Matapan").[[121]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEJackson2006106-124)
triples.statement: The Italian Navy suffered major defeats, with the Royal Navy disabling three Italian battleships in a carrier attack at Taranto and neutralizing more warships at the Battle of Cape Matapan.

triples.sentence: Italian defeats prompted Germany to [deploy an expeditionary force](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Sonnenblume "Operation Sonnenblume") to North Africa; at the end of March 1941, [Rommel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Erwin_Rommel "Erwin Rommel")'s [Afrika Korps](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Afrika_Korps "Afrika Korps")[launched an offensive](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Western_Desert_campaign "Western Desert campaign") which drove back Commonwealth forces.[[122]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTELaurier20017%E2%80%938-125)
triples.statement: Due to Italian defeats, Germany sent an expeditionary force to North Africa, and at the end of March 1941, Rommel's Afrika Korps launched an offensive that pushed back Commonwealth forces.

triples.sentence: In less than a month, Axis forces advanced to western Egypt and [besieged the port of Tobruk](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Siege_of_Tobruk "Siege of Tobruk").[[123]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEMurrayMillett2001263%E2%80%93276-126)
triples.statement: Within a month, Axis forces advanced to western Egypt and besieged the port of Tobruk.

triples.sentence: Germany and Italy responded with simultaneous invasions of both [Yugoslavia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Invasion_of_Yugoslavia "Invasion of Yugoslavia") and [Greece](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/German_invasion_of_Greece "German invasion of Greece"), commencing on 6 April 1941; both nations were forced to surrender within the month.[[124]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEGilbert1989174%E2%80%93175-127)
triples.statement: In response, Germany and Italy simultaneously invaded both Yugoslavia and Greece on April 6, 1941, forcing both nations to surrender within the month.

triples.sentence: The airborne [invasion of the Greek island of Crete](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Crete "Battle of Crete") at the end of May completed the German conquest of the Balkans.[[125]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEGilbert1989184%E2%80%93187-128)
triples.statement: The German conquest of the Balkans was finalized with the airborne invasion of the Greek island of Crete at the end of May.

triples.sentence: Partisan warfare subsequently broke out against the [Axis occupation of Yugoslavia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II_in_Yugoslavia "World War II in Yugoslavia"), which continued until the end of the war.[[126]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEGilbert1989208,_575,_604-129)
triples.statement: Following the Axis occupation of Yugoslavia, partisan warfare emerged and continued until the end of the war.

triples.sentence: In the Middle East in May, Commonwealth forces [quashed an uprising in Iraq](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anglo-Iraqi_War "Anglo-Iraqi War") which had been supported by German aircraft from bases within Vichy-controlled [Syria](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mandate_for_Syria_and_the_Lebanon "Mandate for Syria and the Lebanon").[[127]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEWatson200380-130)
triples.statement: In May, Commonwealth forces in the Middle East suppressed an uprising in Iraq that had been supported by German aircraft from bases in Vichy-controlled Syria.

triples.sentence: Between June and July, British-led forces [invaded and occupied the French possessions of Syria and Lebanon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syria%E2%80%93Lebanon_campaign "Syria–Lebanon campaign"), assisted by the [Free French](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Free_France "Free France").[[128]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-131)
triples.statement: Between June and July, British-led forces, aided by the Free French, invaded and occupied the French territories of Syria and Lebanon.

section_body:
Main article: [Eastern Front (World War II)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eastern_Front_(World_War_II) "Eastern Front (World War II)")

[![Image 29](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/74/Second_world_war_europe_animation_large_de.gif/330px-Second_world_war_europe_animation_large_de.gif)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Second_world_war_europe_animation_large_de.gif)

[European theatre of World War II](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/European_theatre_of_World_War_II "European theatre of World War II") animation map, 1939–1945 – Red: [Western Allies](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Allies_of_World_War_II "Allies of World War II") and the Soviet Union after 1941; Green: [Soviet Union](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soviet_Union "Soviet Union") before 1941; Blue: [Axis powers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Axis_powers "Axis powers")

With the situation in Europe and Asia relatively stable, Germany, Japan, and the Soviet Union made preparations for war. With the Soviets wary of mounting tensions with Germany, and the Japanese planning to take advantage of the European War by seizing resource-rich European possessions in [Southeast Asia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Southeast_Asia "Southeast Asia"), the two powers signed the [Soviet–Japanese Neutrality Pact](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soviet%E2%80%93Japanese_Neutrality_Pact "Soviet–Japanese Neutrality Pact") in April 1941.[[129]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEGarver1988114-132) By contrast, the Germans were steadily making preparations for an attack on the Soviet Union, massing forces on the Soviet border.[[130]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEWeinberg2005195-133)

Hitler believed that the United Kingdom's refusal to end the war was based on the hope that the United States and the Soviet Union would enter the war against Germany.[[131]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEMurray1983[httpswwwibiblioorghyperwarAAFAAF-LuftwaffeAAF-Luftwaffe-3html_69]-134) On 31 July 1940, Hitler decided that the Soviet Union should be eliminated and aimed for the conquest of [Ukraine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ukrainian_Soviet_Socialist_Republic "Ukrainian Soviet Socialist Republic"), the [Baltic states](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Baltic_states "Baltic states") and [Byelorussia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Byelorussian_Soviet_Socialist_Republic "Byelorussian Soviet Socialist Republic").[[132]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-GSWW4_26-135) However, other senior German officials like Ribbentrop saw an opportunity to create a Euro-Asian bloc against the British Empire by inviting the Soviet Union into the Tripartite Pact.[[133]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-GSWW4_38-136) In November 1940, [negotiations took place](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/German%E2%80%93Soviet_Axis_talks "German–Soviet Axis talks") to determine if the Soviet Union would join the pact. The Soviets showed some interest but asked for concessions from Finland, Bulgaria, Turkey, and Japan that Germany considered unacceptable. On 18 December 1940, Hitler issued the directive to prepare for an invasion of the Soviet Union.[[134]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEShirer1990810%E2%80%93812-137)

On 22 June 1941, Germany, supported by Italy and Romania, invaded the Soviet Union in [Operation Barbarossa](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Barbarossa "Operation Barbarossa"), with Germany accusing the Soviets of [plotting against them](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soviet_offensive_plans_controversy "Soviet offensive plans controversy"); they were joined shortly by Finland and Hungary.[[135]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Events1941-138) The primary targets of this surprise offensive[[136]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTESella1978555-139) were the [Baltic region](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Baltic_region "Baltic region"), Moscow and Ukraine, with the [ultimate goal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Strategic_goal_(military) "Strategic goal (military)") of ending the 1941 campaign near the [Arkhangelsk–Astrakhan line](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A%E2%80%93A_line "A–A line")—from the [Caspian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Caspian_Sea "Caspian Sea") to the [White Seas](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/White_Sea "White Sea"). Hitler's objectives were to eliminate the Soviet Union as a military power, exterminate [communism](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Communism "Communism"), generate _[Lebensraum](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lebensraum "Lebensraum")_ ("living space")[[137]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEKershaw200766%E2%80%9369-140) by [dispossessing the native population](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Generalplan_Ost "Generalplan Ost"),[[138]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTESteinberg1995-141) and guarantee access to the strategic resources needed to defeat Germany's remaining rivals.[[139]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEHauner1978-142)

Although the [Red Army](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Red_Army "Red Army") was preparing for strategic [counter-offensives](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Counter-offensive "Counter-offensive") before the war,[[140]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTERoberts1995-143) Operation Barbarossa forced the [Soviet supreme command](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stavka "Stavka") to adopt [strategic defence](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Strategic_defence "Strategic defence"). During the summer, the Axis made significant gains into Soviet territory, inflicting immense losses in both personnel and materiel. By mid-August, however, the German [Army High Command](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oberkommando_des_Heeres "Oberkommando des Heeres") decided to [suspend the offensive](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Smolensk_(1941) "Battle of Smolensk (1941)") of a considerably depleted [Army Group Centre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Army_Group_Centre "Army Group Centre"), and to divert the [2nd Panzer Group](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2nd_Panzer_Army "2nd Panzer Army") to reinforce troops advancing towards central Ukraine and Leningrad.[[141]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEWilt1981-144) The [Kiev offensive](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Kiev_(1941) "Battle of Kiev (1941)") was overwhelmingly successful, resulting in encirclement and elimination of four Soviet armies, and made possible further [advance into Crimea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crimean_campaign "Crimean campaign") and industrially-developed eastern Ukraine (the [First Battle of Kharkov](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/First_Battle_of_Kharkov "First Battle of Kharkov")).[[142]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEErickson2003114%E2%80%93137-145)

[![Image 30](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/17/RIAN_archive_2153_After_bombing.jpg/250px-RIAN_archive_2153_After_bombing.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:RIAN_archive_2153_After_bombing.jpg)

Russian civilians leaving destroyed houses after a German bombardment during the [siege of Leningrad](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Siege_of_Leningrad "Siege of Leningrad") ([Saint Petersburg](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saint_Petersburg "Saint Petersburg")), 10 December 1942

The diversion of three-quarters of the Axis troops and the majority of their air forces from France and the central Mediterranean to the [Eastern Front](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eastern_Front_(World_War_II) "Eastern Front (World War II)")[[143]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEGlantz20019-146) prompted the United Kingdom to reconsider its [grand strategy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grand_strategy "Grand strategy").[[144]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEFarrell1993-147) In July, the UK and the Soviet Union formed a [military alliance against Germany](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anglo-Soviet_Agreement "Anglo-Soviet Agreement")[[145]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEKeeble199029-148) and in August, the United Kingdom and the United States jointly issued the [Atlantic Charter](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Atlantic_Charter "Atlantic Charter"), which outlined British and American goals for the post-war world.[[146]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBeevor2012220-149) In late August the British and Soviets [invaded neutral Iran](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anglo-Soviet_invasion_of_Iran "Anglo-Soviet invasion of Iran") to secure the [Persian Corridor](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Persian_Corridor "Persian Corridor"), Iran's [oil fields](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oil_fields "Oil fields"), and preempt any Axis advances through Iran toward the Baku oil fields or India.[[147]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBueno_de_MesquitaSmithSiversonMorrow2003425-150)

By October, Axis powers had achieved [operational objectives](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operational_objective "Operational objective") in Ukraine and the Baltic region, with only the sieges of [Leningrad](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Siege_of_Leningrad "Siege of Leningrad")[[148]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEKleinfeld1983-151) and [Sevastopol](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Siege_of_Sevastopol_(1941%E2%80%931942) "Siege of Sevastopol (1941–1942)") continuing.[[149]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEJukes2001113-152) A major [offensive against Moscow](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Moscow "Battle of Moscow") was renewed; after two months of fierce battles in increasingly harsh weather, the German army almost reached the outer suburbs of Moscow, where the exhausted troops[[150]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-153) were forced to suspend the offensive.[[151]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEReinhardt1992227-154) Large territorial gains were made by Axis forces, but their campaign had failed to achieve its main objectives: two key cities remained in Soviet hands, the Soviet [capability to resist](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Military_capability "Military capability") was not broken, and the Soviet Union retained a considerable part of its military potential. The _blitzkrieg_[phase](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Phase_(combat) "Phase (combat)") of the war in Europe had ended.[[152]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEMilward1964-155)

By early December, freshly mobilised [reserves](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Military_reserve_force "Military reserve force")[[153]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTERotundo1986-156) allowed the Soviets to achieve numerical parity with Axis troops.[[154]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEGlantz200126-157) This, as well as [intelligence data](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_Sorge#Wartime_intelligence "Richard Sorge") which established that a minimal number of Soviet troops in the East would be sufficient to deter any attack by the Japanese [Kwantung Army](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kwantung_Army "Kwantung Army"),[[155]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-158) allowed the Soviets to begin a [massive counter-offensive](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Winter_campaign_of_1941%E2%80%931942 "Winter campaign of 1941–1942") that started on 5 December all along the front and pushed German troops 100–250 kilometres (62–155 mi) west.[[156]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-159)

section_body:
Main article: [Pacific War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pacific_War "Pacific War")

[![Image 31](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/46/228_regiment_in_HK.jpg/250px-228_regiment_in_HK.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:228_regiment_in_HK.jpg)

Japanese soldiers [entering Hong Kong](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Hong_Kong "Battle of Hong Kong"), 8 December 1941

Following the Japanese [false flag](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/False_flag "False flag")[Mukden incident](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mukden_incident "Mukden incident") in 1931, the Japanese shelling of the American [gunboat USS _Panay_](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Panay_incident "USS Panay incident") in 1937, and the 1937–1938 [Nanjing Massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nanjing_Massacre "Nanjing Massacre"), [Japanese-American relations deteriorated](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japan%E2%80%93United_States_relations#1937%E2%80%931941 "Japan–United States relations"). In 1939, the United States notified Japan that it would not be extending its trade treaty and American public opinion opposing Japanese expansionism led to a series of economic sanctions—the [Export Control Acts](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Export_Control_Act "Export Control Act")—which banned US exports of chemicals, minerals and military parts to Japan, and increased economic pressure on the Japanese regime.[[113]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-ibiblio_1940-116)[[157]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-160)[[158]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-ReferenceC-161) During 1939 Japan launched its [first attack against Changsha](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Changsha_(1939) "Battle of Changsha (1939)"), but was repulsed by late September.[[159]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEJowettAndrew200214-162) Despite [several offensives](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1939%E2%80%931940_Winter_Offensive "1939–1940 Winter Offensive") by both sides, by 1940 the war between China and Japan was at a stalemate. To increase pressure on China by blocking supply routes, and to better position Japanese forces in the event of a war with the Western powers, Japan invaded and [occupied northern Indochina](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_invasion_of_French_Indochina "Japanese invasion of French Indochina") in September 1940.[[160]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEOveryWheatcroft1999289-163)

Chinese nationalist forces launched a large-scale [counter-offensive](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1939%E2%80%931940_Winter_Offensive "1939–1940 Winter Offensive") in early 1940. In August, [Chinese communists](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chinese_Communist_Party "Chinese Communist Party") launched an [offensive in Central China](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hundred_Regiments_Offensive "Hundred Regiments Offensive");[[161]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEFrank2020161-164) in retaliation, Japan instituted [harsh measures](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Three_Alls_policy "Three Alls policy") in occupied areas to reduce human and material resources for the communists.[[162]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEJoes2004224-165) Continued antipathy between Chinese communist and nationalist forces [culminated in armed clashes in January 1941](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_Fourth_Army_incident "New Fourth Army incident"), effectively ending their co-operation.[[163]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEFairbankGoldman2006320-166) In March, the Japanese 11th army attacked the headquarters of the nationalist Chinese 19th army but was repulsed during the [Battle of Shanggao](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Shanggao "Battle of Shanggao").[[164]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEHsuChang197130-167) In September, Japan attempted to [take the city of Changsha](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Changsha_(1941) "Battle of Changsha (1941)") again and clashed with Chinese nationalist forces.[[165]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEHsuChang197133-168)

German successes in Europe prompted Japan to increase pressure on European governments in [Southeast Asia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Southeast_Asia "Southeast Asia"). The Dutch government agreed to provide Japan with oil supplies from the [Dutch East Indies](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dutch_East_Indies "Dutch East Indies"), but negotiations for additional access to their resources ended in failure in June 1941.[[166]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-169) In July 1941 Japan sent troops to southern Indochina, threatening British and Dutch possessions in the Far East. The United States, the United Kingdom, and other Western governments reacted to this move with a freeze on Japanese assets and a total oil [embargo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Economic_sanctions "Economic sanctions").[[167]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEAnderson1975201-170)[[168]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEEvansPeattie2012456-171) At the same time, Japan was [planning an invasion of the Soviet Far East](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kantokuen "Kantokuen"), intending to take advantage of the German invasion in the west, but abandoned the operation after the sanctions.[[169]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-172)

Since early 1941, the United States and Japan had been engaged in negotiations in an attempt to improve their strained relations and end the war in China. Japan advanced a number of proposals which were dismissed by the Americans as inadequate.[[170]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-USAWWIIcp5-173) At the same time the United States, the United Kingdom, and the Netherlands engaged in secret discussions for the joint defence of their territories, in the event of a Japanese attack against any of them.[[171]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-USAWWIIcp4-174) Roosevelt reinforced [the Philippines](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Commonwealth_of_the_Philippines "Commonwealth of the Philippines") (an American protectorate scheduled for independence in 1946) and warned Japan that the United States would react to Japanese attacks against any "neighboring countries".[[171]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-USAWWIIcp4-174)

[![Image 32](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/09/The_USS_Arizona_%28BB-39%29_burning_after_the_Japanese_attack_on_Pearl_Harbor_-_NARA_195617_-_Edit.jpg/250px-The_USS_Arizona_%28BB-39%29_burning_after_the_Japanese_attack_on_Pearl_Harbor_-_NARA_195617_-_Edit.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:The_USS_Arizona_(BB-39)_burning_after_the_Japanese_attack_on_Pearl_Harbor_-_NARA_195617_-_Edit.jpg)

The [USS _Arizona_](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Arizona "USS Arizona") was a total loss in the [Japanese surprise air attack](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Attack_on_Pearl_Harbor "Attack on Pearl Harbor") on the [United States Pacific Fleet](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Pacific_Fleet "United States Pacific Fleet") at [Pearl Harbor](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pearl_Harbor "Pearl Harbor"), Sunday 7 December 1941

Frustrated at the lack of progress and feeling the pinch of the American–British–Dutch sanctions, Japan prepared for war. Emperor [Hirohito](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hirohito "Hirohito"), after initial hesitation about Japan's chances of victory,[[172]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBix2000399%E2%80%93414-175) began to favour Japan's entry into the war.[[173]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-176) As a result, Prime Minister [Fumimaro Konoe](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fumimaro_Konoe "Fumimaro Konoe") resigned.[[174]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-177)[[175]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBix2000417%E2%80%93420-178) Hirohito refused the recommendation to appoint [Prince Naruhiko Higashikuni](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prince_Naruhiko_Higashikuni "Prince Naruhiko Higashikuni") in his place, choosing War Minister [Hideki Tojo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hideki_Tojo "Hideki Tojo") instead.[[176]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBix2000418-179) On 3 November, Nagano explained in detail the plan of the [attack on Pearl Harbor](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Attack_on_Pearl_Harbor "Attack on Pearl Harbor") to the Emperor.[[177]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-180) On 5 November, Hirohito approved in imperial conference the operations plan for the war.[[178]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBix2000424-181) On 20 November, the new government presented an interim proposal as its final offer. It called for the end of American aid to China and for lifting the embargo on the supply of oil and other resources to Japan. In exchange, Japan promised not to launch any attacks in Southeast Asia and to withdraw its forces from southern Indochina.[[170]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-USAWWIIcp5-173) The American counter-proposal of 26 November required that Japan evacuate all of China without conditions and conclude non-aggression pacts with all Pacific powers.[[179]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-182) That meant Japan was essentially forced to choose between abandoning its ambitions in China, or seizing the natural resources it needed in the Dutch East Indies by force;[[180]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-183)[[181]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-184) the Japanese military did not consider the former an option, and many officers considered the oil embargo an unspoken declaration of war.[[182]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTELightbody2004125-185)

Japan planned to seize European colonies in Asia to create a large defensive perimeter stretching into the Central Pacific. The Japanese would then be free to exploit the resources of Southeast Asia while exhausting the over-stretched Allies by fighting a defensive war.[[183]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-186)[[184]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-187) To prevent American intervention while securing the perimeter, it was further planned to neutralise the [United States Pacific Fleet](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Pacific_Fleet "United States Pacific Fleet") and the American military presence in the Philippines from the outset.[[185]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEWood200711%E2%80%9312-188) On 7 December 1941 (8 December in Asian time zones), Japan attacked British and American holdings with near-simultaneous [offensives against Southeast Asia and the Central Pacific](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_expansion_(1941%E2%80%9342) "Japanese expansion (1941–42)").[[186]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEWohlstetter1962341%E2%80%93343-189) These included an [attack on the American fleets at Pearl Harbor](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Attack_on_Pearl_Harbor "Attack on Pearl Harbor") and [the Philippines](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philippines_campaign_(1941%E2%80%931942) "Philippines campaign (1941–1942)"), as well as invasions of [Guam](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Guam_(1941) "Battle of Guam (1941)"), [Wake Island](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Wake_Island "Battle of Wake Island"), [Malaya](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Malayan_campaign "Malayan campaign"),[[186]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEWohlstetter1962341%E2%80%93343-189)[Thailand](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_invasion_of_Thailand "Japanese invasion of Thailand"), and [Hong Kong](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Hong_Kong "Battle of Hong Kong").[[187]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-190)

These attacks led the [United States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_declaration_of_war_on_Japan "United States declaration of war on Japan"), [United Kingdom](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Kingdom_declaration_of_war_on_Japan "United Kingdom declaration of war on Japan"), China, Australia, and several other states to formally declare war on Japan, whereas the Soviet Union, being heavily involved in large-scale hostilities with European Axis countries, maintained its neutrality agreement with Japan.[[188]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-191) Germany, followed by the other Axis states, declared war on the United States[[189]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-192) in solidarity with Japan, citing as justification the American attacks on German war vessels that had been ordered by Roosevelt.[[135]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Events1941-138)[[190]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-193)

triples.sentence: In 1939, the United States notified Japan that it would not be extending its trade treaty and American public opinion opposing Japanese expansionism led to a series of economic sanctions—the [Export Control Acts](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Export_Control_Act "Export Control Act")—which banned US exports of chemicals, minerals and military parts to Japan, and increased economic pressure on the Japanese regime.[[113]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-ibiblio_1940-116)[[157]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-160)[[158]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-ReferenceC-161)
triples.statement: In 1939, the U.S. informed Japan it would not extend their trade treaty and, due to public opinion against Japanese expansion, imposed economic sanctions via the Export Control Acts, banning exports of chemicals, minerals, and military parts to Japan.

triples.sentence: During 1939 Japan launched its [first attack against Changsha](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Changsha_(1939) "Battle of Changsha (1939)"), but was repulsed by late September.[[159]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEJowettAndrew200214-162)
triples.statement: Japan's first attack against Changsha in 1939 was repulsed by late September.

triples.sentence: To increase pressure on China by blocking supply routes, and to better position Japanese forces in the event of a war with the Western powers, Japan invaded and [occupied northern Indochina](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_invasion_of_French_Indochina "Japanese invasion of French Indochina") in September 1940.[[160]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEOveryWheatcroft1999289-163)
triples.statement: In September 1940, Japan invaded and occupied northern Indochina to increase pressure on China by blocking supply routes and to better position its forces for a potential war with Western powers.

triples.sentence: In August, [Chinese communists](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chinese_Communist_Party "Chinese Communist Party") launched an [offensive in Central China](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hundred_Regiments_Offensive "Hundred Regiments Offensive");[[161]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEFrank2020161-164) in retaliation, Japan instituted [harsh measures](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Three_Alls_policy "Three Alls policy") in occupied areas to reduce human and material resources for the communists.[[162]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEJoes2004224-165)
triples.statement: After Chinese communists launched an offensive in Central China in August, Japan retaliated with harsh measures in occupied areas to reduce communist resources.

triples.sentence: Continued antipathy between Chinese communist and nationalist forces [culminated in armed clashes in January 1941](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_Fourth_Army_incident "New Fourth Army incident"), effectively ending their co-operation.[[163]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEFairbankGoldman2006320-166)
triples.statement: Ongoing hostility between Chinese communist and nationalist forces led to armed clashes in January 1941, which ended their cooperation.

triples.sentence: In March, the Japanese 11th army attacked the headquarters of the nationalist Chinese 19th army but was repulsed during the [Battle of Shanggao](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Shanggao "Battle of Shanggao").[[164]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEHsuChang197130-167)
triples.statement: The Japanese 11th army's attack on the headquarters of the nationalist Chinese 19th army in March was repelled during the Battle of Shanggao.

triples.sentence: In September, Japan attempted to [take the city of Changsha](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Changsha_(1941) "Battle of Changsha (1941)") again and clashed with Chinese nationalist forces.[[165]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEHsuChang197133-168)
triples.statement: In September, Japan again tried to capture Changsha, leading to clashes with Chinese nationalist forces.

triples.sentence: The United States, the United Kingdom, and other Western governments reacted to this move with a freeze on Japanese assets and a total oil [embargo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Economic_sanctions "Economic sanctions").[[167]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEAnderson1975201-170)[[168]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEEvansPeattie2012456-171)
triples.statement: In response to Japan's move into southern Indochina, the U.S., U.K., and other Western governments froze Japanese assets and imposed a total oil embargo.

triples.sentence: At the same time, Japan was [planning an invasion of the Soviet Far East](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kantokuen "Kantokuen"), intending to take advantage of the German invasion in the west, but abandoned the operation after the sanctions.[[169]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-172)
triples.statement: Japan had been planning an invasion of the Soviet Far East to coincide with the German invasion, but cancelled the operation following the imposition of sanctions.

triples.sentence: Emperor [Hirohito](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hirohito "Hirohito"), after initial hesitation about Japan's chances of victory,[[172]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBix2000399%E2%80%93414-175) began to favour Japan's entry into the war.[[173]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-176)
triples.statement: After some initial hesitation, Emperor Hirohito started to support Japan's entry into the war.

triples.sentence: As a result, Prime Minister [Fumimaro Konoe](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fumimaro_Konoe "Fumimaro Konoe") resigned.[[174]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-177)[[175]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBix2000417%E2%80%93420-178)
triples.statement: Consequently, Prime Minister Fumimaro Konoe resigned.

triples.sentence: Hirohito refused the recommendation to appoint [Prince Naruhiko Higashikuni](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prince_Naruhiko_Higashikuni "Prince Naruhiko Higashikuni") in his place, choosing War Minister [Hideki Tojo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hideki_Tojo "Hideki Tojo") instead.[[176]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBix2000418-179)
triples.statement: Instead of the recommended Prince Naruhiko Higashikuni, Emperor Hirohito appointed War Minister Hideki Tojo as the new Prime Minister.

triples.sentence: On 3 November, Nagano explained in detail the plan of the [attack on Pearl Harbor](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Attack_on_Pearl_Harbor "Attack on Pearl Harbor") to the Emperor.[[177]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-180)
triples.statement: On November 3, Nagano detailed the plan for the attack on Pearl Harbor to the Emperor.

triples.sentence: On 5 November, Hirohito approved in imperial conference the operations plan for the war.[[178]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBix2000424-181)
triples.statement: Emperor Hirohito approved the war operations plan in an imperial conference on November 5.

triples.sentence: That meant Japan was essentially forced to choose between abandoning its ambitions in China, or seizing the natural resources it needed in the Dutch East Indies by force;[[180]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-183)[[181]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-184) the Japanese military did not consider the former an option, and many officers considered the oil embargo an unspoken declaration of war.[[182]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTELightbody2004125-185)
triples.statement: The American proposal forced Japan to choose between abandoning its ambitions in China or seizing resources from the Dutch East Indies by force; the Japanese military rejected the first option, and many officers viewed the oil embargo as an implicit declaration of war.

triples.sentence: The Japanese would then be free to exploit the resources of Southeast Asia while exhausting the over-stretched Allies by fighting a defensive war.[[183]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-186)[[184]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-187)
triples.statement: This strategy would allow Japan to exploit Southeast Asian resources and wear down the Allies through a defensive war.

triples.sentence: To prevent American intervention while securing the perimeter, it was further planned to neutralise the [United States Pacific Fleet](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Pacific_Fleet "United States Pacific Fleet") and the American military presence in the Philippines from the outset.[[185]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEWood200711%E2%80%9312-188)
triples.statement: The plan also included neutralizing the U.S. Pacific Fleet and its military presence in the Philippines from the start to prevent American intervention.

triples.sentence: On 7 December 1941 (8 December in Asian time zones), Japan attacked British and American holdings with near-simultaneous [offensives against Southeast Asia and the Central Pacific](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_expansion_(1941%E2%80%9342) "Japanese expansion (1941–42)").[[186]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEWohlstetter1962341%E2%80%93343-189)
triples.statement: On December 7, 1941 (December 8 in Asia), Japan launched nearly simultaneous attacks on British and American territories in Southeast Asia and the Central Pacific.

triples.sentence: These included an [attack on the American fleets at Pearl Harbor](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Attack_on_Pearl_Harbor "Attack on Pearl Harbor") and [the Philippines](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philippines_campaign_(1941%E2%80%931942) "Philippines campaign (1941–1942)"), as well as invasions of [Guam](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Guam_(1941) "Battle of Guam (1941)"), [Wake Island](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Wake_Island "Battle of Wake Island"), [Malaya](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Malayan_campaign "Malayan campaign"),[[186]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEWohlstetter1962341%E2%80%93343-189)[Thailand](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_invasion_of_Thailand "Japanese invasion of Thailand"), and [Hong Kong](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Hong_Kong "Battle of Hong Kong").[[187]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-190)
triples.statement: The Japanese offensives included attacks on Pearl Harbor and the Philippines, and invasions of Guam, Wake Island, Malaya, Thailand, and Hong Kong.

triples.sentence: These attacks led the [United States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_declaration_of_war_on_Japan "United States declaration of war on Japan"), [United Kingdom](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Kingdom_declaration_of_war_on_Japan "United Kingdom declaration of war on Japan"), China, Australia, and several other states to formally declare war on Japan, whereas the Soviet Union, being heavily involved in large-scale hostilities with European Axis countries, maintained its neutrality agreement with Japan.[[188]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-191)
triples.statement: Following these attacks, the U.S., U.K., China, Australia, and other nations declared war on Japan, while the Soviet Union remained neutral due to its conflict with European Axis powers.

triples.sentence: Germany, followed by the other Axis states, declared war on the United States[[189]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-192) in solidarity with Japan, citing as justification the American attacks on German war vessels that had been ordered by Roosevelt.[[135]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Events1941-138)[[190]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-193)
triples.statement: Germany and other Axis powers declared war on the United States in support of Japan, justifying the action by citing American attacks on German warships ordered by President Roosevelt.

On 1 January 1942, the [Allied Big Four](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Four_Policemen "Four Policemen")[[191]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBosworthMaiolo2015313%E2%80%93314-194)—the Soviet Union, China, the United Kingdom, and the United States—and 22 smaller or exiled governments issued the [Declaration by United Nations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Declaration_by_United_Nations "Declaration by United Nations"), thereby affirming the [Atlantic Charter](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Atlantic_Charter "Atlantic Charter")[[192]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEMingstKarns200722-195) and agreeing not to sign a [separate peace](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Separate_peace "Separate peace") with the Axis powers.[[193]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEShirer1990904-196)

During 1942, Allied officials debated on the appropriate [grand strategy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grand_strategy "Grand strategy") to pursue. All agreed that [defeating Germany](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Europe_first "Europe first") was the primary objective. The Americans favoured a straightforward, [large-scale attack](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Sledgehammer "Operation Sledgehammer") on Germany through France. The Soviets demanded a second front. The British argued that military operations should target peripheral areas to wear out German strength, leading to increasing demoralisation, and bolstering [resistance forces](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Resistance_during_World_War_II "Resistance during World War II"); Germany itself would be subject to a heavy bombing campaign. An offensive against Germany would then be launched primarily by Allied armour, without using large-scale armies.[[194]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-197) Eventually, the British persuaded the Americans that a landing in France was infeasible in 1942 and they should instead focus on driving the Axis out of North Africa.[[195]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-198)

At the [Casablanca Conference](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Casablanca_Conference "Casablanca Conference") in early 1943, the Allies reiterated the statements issued in the 1942 Declaration and demanded the [unconditional surrender](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unconditional_surrender "Unconditional surrender") of their enemies. The British and Americans agreed to continue to press the initiative in the Mediterranean by invading Sicily to fully secure the Mediterranean supply routes.[[196]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-199) Although the British argued for further operations in the Balkans to bring Turkey into the war, in May 1943, the Americans extracted a British commitment to limit Allied operations in the Mediterranean to an invasion of the Italian mainland, and to invade France in 1944.[[197]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-200)

triples.sentence: On 1 January 1942, the [Allied Big Four](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Four_Policemen "Four Policemen")[[191]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBosworthMaiolo2015313%E2%80%93314-194)—the Soviet Union, China, the United Kingdom, and the United States—and 22 smaller or exiled governments issued the [Declaration by United Nations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Declaration_by_United_Nations "Declaration by United Nations"), thereby affirming the [Atlantic Charter](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Atlantic_Charter "Atlantic Charter")[[192]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEMingstKarns200722-195) and agreeing not to sign a [separate peace](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Separate_peace "Separate peace") with the Axis powers.[[193]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEShirer1990904-196)
triples.statement: On January 1, 1942, the "Allied Big Four" (Soviet Union, China, UK, US) and 22 other governments issued the Declaration by United Nations, affirming the Atlantic Charter and agreeing not to make a separate peace with the Axis powers.

[![Image 33](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/52/Second_world_war_asia_1937-1942_map_en6.png/500px-Second_world_war_asia_1937-1942_map_en6.png)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Second_world_war_asia_1937-1942_map_en6.png)

Map of Japanese military advances through mid-1942

By the end of April 1942, Japan and its ally [Thailand](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thailand_in_World_War_II "Thailand in World War II") had almost conquered [Burma](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_invasion_of_Burma "Japanese invasion of Burma"), [Malaya](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Malayan_campaign "Malayan campaign"), [the Dutch East Indies](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dutch_East_Indies_campaign "Dutch East Indies campaign"), [Singapore](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fall_of_Singapore "Fall of Singapore"), and [Rabaul](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Rabaul_(1942) "Battle of Rabaul (1942)"), inflicting severe losses on Allied troops and taking a large number of prisoners.[[198]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBeevor2012247%E2%80%93267,_345-201) Despite stubborn [resistance by Filipino and US forces](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philippines_campaign_(1941%E2%80%931942) "Philippines campaign (1941–1942)"), the [Philippine Commonwealth](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Commonwealth_of_the_Philippines "Commonwealth of the Philippines") was eventually captured in May 1942, forcing its government into exile.[[199]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTELewis1953p._529_(Table_11)-202) On 16 April, in Burma, 7,000 British soldiers were encircled by the Japanese 33rd Division during the [Battle of Yenangyaung](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Yenangyaung "Battle of Yenangyaung") and rescued by the Chinese 38th Division.[[200]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTESlim195671%E2%80%9374-203) Japanese forces achieved naval victories in the [South China Sea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sinking_of_Prince_of_Wales_and_Repulse "Sinking of Prince of Wales and Repulse"), [Java Sea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_the_Java_Sea "Battle of the Java Sea"), and [Indian Ocean](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Indian_Ocean_raid "Indian Ocean raid"),[[201]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEGrove1995362-204) and [bombed the Allied naval base](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bombing_of_Darwin "Bombing of Darwin") at [Darwin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Darwin,_Northern_Territory "Darwin, Northern Territory"), Australia. In January 1942, the only Allied success against Japan was a Chinese [victory at Changsha](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Changsha_(1941%E2%80%931942) "Battle of Changsha (1941–1942)").[[202]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTECh'i1992158-205) These easy victories over the unprepared US and European opponents left Japan overconfident, and overextended.[[203]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEPerez1998145-206)

In early May 1942, Japan initiated operations to [capture Port Moresby](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Mo "Operation Mo") by [amphibious assault](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amphibious_warfare "Amphibious warfare") and thus sever communications and supply lines between the United States and Australia. The planned invasion was thwarted when an Allied task force, centred on two American fleet carriers, fought Japanese naval forces to a draw in the [Battle of the Coral Sea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_the_Coral_Sea "Battle of the Coral Sea").[[204]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEMaddox1992111%E2%80%93112-207) Japan's next plan, motivated by the earlier [Doolittle Raid](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Doolittle_Raid "Doolittle Raid"), was to seize [Midway Atoll](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Midway_Atoll "Midway Atoll") and lure American carriers into battle to be eliminated; as a diversion, Japan would also send forces to [occupy the Aleutian Islands](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aleutian_Islands_campaign "Aleutian Islands campaign") in Alaska.[[205]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTESalecker2001186-208) In mid-May, Japan started the [Zhejiang-Jiangxi campaign](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zhejiang-Jiangxi_campaign "Zhejiang-Jiangxi campaign") in China, with the goal of inflicting retribution on the Chinese who aided the surviving American airmen in the Doolittle Raid by destroying Chinese air bases and fighting against the Chinese 23rd and 32nd Army Groups.[[206]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-209)[[207]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-210) In early June, Japan put its operations into action, but the Americans had broken [Japanese naval codes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_naval_codes "Japanese naval codes") in late May and were fully aware of the plans and order of battle, and used this knowledge to achieve a decisive [victory at Midway](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Midway "Battle of Midway") over the [Imperial Japanese Navy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Imperial_Japanese_Navy "Imperial Japanese Navy").[[208]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-211)

With its capacity for aggressive action greatly diminished as a result of the Midway battle, Japan attempted to capture [Port Moresby](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Port_Moresby "Port Moresby") by an [overland campaign](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kokoda_Track_campaign "Kokoda Track campaign") in the [Territory of Papua](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Territory_of_Papua "Territory of Papua").[[209]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEWeinberg2005339-212) The Americans planned a counterattack against Japanese positions in the southern [Solomon Islands](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Solomon_Islands "Solomon Islands"), primarily [Guadalcanal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guadalcanal "Guadalcanal"), as a first step towards capturing [Rabaul](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rabaul "Rabaul"), the main Japanese base in Southeast Asia.[[210]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-213)

Both plans started in July, but by mid-September, the [Battle for Guadalcanal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guadalcanal_campaign "Guadalcanal campaign") took priority for the Japanese, and troops in New Guinea were ordered to withdraw from the Port Moresby area to the [northern part of the island](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oro_Province "Oro Province"), where they faced Australian and United States troops in the [Battle of Buna–Gona](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Buna%E2%80%93Gona "Battle of Buna–Gona").[[211]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTESwain2001197-214) Guadalcanal soon became a focal point for both sides with heavy commitments of troops and ships in the battle for Guadalcanal. By the start of 1943, the Japanese were defeated on the island and [withdrew their troops](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Ke "Operation Ke").[[212]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEHane2001340-215) In Burma, Commonwealth forces mounted two operations. The first was a disastrous [offensive into the Arakan region](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arakan_campaign_(1942%E2%80%931943) "Arakan campaign (1942–1943)") in late 1942 that forced a retreat back to India by May 1943.[[213]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEMarston2005111-216) The second was the [insertion of irregular forces](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Longcloth "Operation Longcloth") behind Japanese frontlines in February which, by the end of April, had achieved mixed results.[[214]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBrayley20029-217)

triples.sentence: By the end of April 1942, Japan and its ally [Thailand](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thailand_in_World_War_II "Thailand in World War II") had almost conquered [Burma](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_invasion_of_Burma "Japanese invasion of Burma"), [Malaya](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Malayan_campaign "Malayan campaign"), [the Dutch East Indies](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dutch_East_Indies_campaign "Dutch East Indies campaign"), [Singapore](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fall_of_Singapore "Fall of Singapore"), and [Rabaul](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Rabaul_(1942) "Battle of Rabaul (1942)"), inflicting severe losses on Allied troops and taking a large number of prisoners.[[198]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBeevor2012247%E2%80%93267,_345-201)
triples.statement: By the end of April 1942, Japan and its ally Thailand had nearly conquered Burma, Malaya, the Dutch East Indies, Singapore, and Rabaul, causing heavy losses for Allied troops and capturing many prisoners.

triples.sentence: Despite stubborn [resistance by Filipino and US forces](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philippines_campaign_(1941%E2%80%931942) "Philippines campaign (1941–1942)"), the [Philippine Commonwealth](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Commonwealth_of_the_Philippines "Commonwealth of the Philippines") was eventually captured in May 1942, forcing its government into exile.[[199]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTELewis1953p._529_(Table_11)-202)
triples.statement: The Philippine Commonwealth was captured in May 1942, despite resistance from Filipino and US forces, which forced its government into exile.

triples.sentence: On 16 April, in Burma, 7,000 British soldiers were encircled by the Japanese 33rd Division during the [Battle of Yenangyaung](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Yenangyaung "Battle of Yenangyaung") and rescued by the Chinese 38th Division.[[200]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTESlim195671%E2%80%9374-203)
triples.statement: On April 16 in Burma, the Chinese 38th Division rescued 7,000 British soldiers who had been encircled by the Japanese 33rd Division during the Battle of Yenangyaung.

triples.sentence: Japanese forces achieved naval victories in the [South China Sea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sinking_of_Prince_of_Wales_and_Repulse "Sinking of Prince of Wales and Repulse"), [Java Sea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_the_Java_Sea "Battle of the Java Sea"), and [Indian Ocean](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Indian_Ocean_raid "Indian Ocean raid"),[[201]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEGrove1995362-204) and [bombed the Allied naval base](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bombing_of_Darwin "Bombing of Darwin") at [Darwin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Darwin,_Northern_Territory "Darwin, Northern Territory"), Australia.
triples.statement: Japanese forces won naval victories in the South China Sea, Java Sea, and Indian Ocean, and also bombed the Allied naval base at Darwin, Australia.

triples.statement: The only Allied success against Japan in January 1942 was a Chinese victory at Changsha.

triples.statement: Japan's easy victories over unprepared US and European opponents resulted in the country becoming overconfident and overextended.

triples.statement: Motivated by the Doolittle Raid, Japan's subsequent plan was to seize Midway Atoll to eliminate American carriers, while also sending forces to occupy the Aleutian Islands in Alaska as a diversion.

[![Image 34](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ef/RIAN_archive_44732_Soviet_soldiers_attack_house.jpg/500px-RIAN_archive_44732_Soviet_soldiers_attack_house.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:RIAN_archive_44732_Soviet_soldiers_attack_house.jpg)

[Red Army](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Red_Army "Red Army") soldiers on the counterattack during the [Battle of Stalingrad](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Stalingrad "Battle of Stalingrad"), February 1943

Despite considerable losses, in early 1942 Germany and its allies stopped a major Soviet offensive in [central](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Central_Russia "Central Russia") and [southern Russia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Southern_Russia "Southern Russia"), keeping most territorial gains they had achieved during the previous year.[[215]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEGlantz200131-218) In May, the Germans defeated Soviet offensives in the [Kerch Peninsula](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_the_Kerch_Peninsula "Battle of the Kerch Peninsula") and at [Kharkov](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Second_Battle_of_Kharkov "Second Battle of Kharkov"),[[216]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTERead2004764-219) and then in June 1942 launched their main [summer offensive](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Case_Blue "Case Blue") against southern Russia, to seize the [oil fields of the Caucasus](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Petroleum_industry_in_Azerbaijan "Petroleum industry in Azerbaijan") and occupy the [Kuban](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kuban "Kuban")[steppe](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Steppe "Steppe"), while maintaining positions on the northern and central areas of the front. The Germans split [Army Group South](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Army_Group_South "Army Group South") into two groups: [Army Group A](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Army_Group_A "Army Group A") advanced to the lower [Don River](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Don_(river) "Don (river)") and struck south-east to the Caucasus, while [Army Group B](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Army_Group_B "Army Group B") headed towards the [Volga River](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Volga "Volga"). The Soviets decided to make their stand at Stalingrad on the Volga.[[217]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEDavies2006p._100_(2008_ed.)-220)

By mid-November, the Germans had [nearly taken Stalingrad](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Stalingrad "Battle of Stalingrad") in bitter [street fighting](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Urban_warfare "Urban warfare"). The Soviets began their second winter counter-offensive, starting with an [encirclement of German forces at Stalingrad](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Uranus "Operation Uranus"),[[218]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBeevor1998239%E2%80%93265-221) and an assault on the [Rzhev salient near Moscow](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Mars "Operation Mars"), though the latter failed disastrously.[[219]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBlack2003119-222) By early February 1943, the German army had taken tremendous losses; German troops at Stalingrad had been defeated,[[220]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBeevor1998383%E2%80%93391-223) and the front-line had been pushed back beyond its position before the summer offensive. In mid-February, after the Soviet push had tapered off, the Germans launched another [attack on Kharkov](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Third_Battle_of_Kharkov "Third Battle of Kharkov"), creating a [salient](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Salient_(military) "Salient (military)") in their front line around the Soviet city of [Kursk](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kursk "Kursk").[[221]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEErickson2001142-224)

triples.sentence: Despite considerable losses, in early 1942 Germany and its allies stopped a major Soviet offensive in [central](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Central_Russia "Central Russia") and [southern Russia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Southern_Russia "Southern Russia"), keeping most territorial gains they had achieved during the previous year.[[215]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEGlantz200131-218)
triples.statement: In early 1942, despite significant losses, Germany and its allies halted a major Soviet offensive in central and southern Russia, maintaining most of their territorial gains from the prior year.

triples.sentence: In May, the Germans defeated Soviet offensives in the [Kerch Peninsula](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_the_Kerch_Peninsula "Battle of the Kerch Peninsula") and at [Kharkov](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Second_Battle_of_Kharkov "Second Battle of Kharkov"),[[216]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTERead2004764-219) and then in June 1942 launched their main [summer offensive](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Case_Blue "Case Blue") against southern Russia, to seize the [oil fields of the Caucasus](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Petroleum_industry_in_Azerbaijan "Petroleum industry in Azerbaijan") and occupy the [Kuban](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kuban "Kuban")[steppe](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Steppe "Steppe"), while maintaining positions on the northern and central areas of the front.
triples.statement: In May 1942, Germans defeated Soviet attacks in the Kerch Peninsula and at Kharkov, and in June launched a major summer offensive in southern Russia to capture the Caucasus oil fields and the Kuban steppe.

triples.sentence: The Soviets decided to make their stand at Stalingrad on the Volga.[[217]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEDavies2006p._100_(2008_ed.)-220)
triples.statement: The Soviets chose to make their stand at Stalingrad on the Volga River.

triples.statement: The Soviets initiated their second winter counter-offensive by encircling German forces at Stalingrad and launching a disastrously failed assault on the Rzhev salient near Moscow.

triples.sentence: By early February 1943, the German army had taken tremendous losses; German troops at Stalingrad had been defeated,[[220]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBeevor1998383%E2%80%93391-223) and the front-line had been pushed back beyond its position before the summer offensive.
triples.statement: By early February 1943, the German army had suffered immense losses, its troops were defeated at Stalingrad, and the front line was pushed back beyond its position before the summer offensive.

triples.sentence: In mid-February, after the Soviet push had tapered off, the Germans launched another [attack on Kharkov](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Third_Battle_of_Kharkov "Third Battle of Kharkov"), creating a [salient](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Salient_(military) "Salient (military)") in their front line around the Soviet city of [Kursk](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kursk "Kursk").[[221]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEErickson2001142-224)
triples.statement: In mid-February, after the Soviet offensive slowed, the Germans attacked Kharkov again, which created a salient in their front line around the city of Kursk.
