[![Image 35](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a5/8th_AF_Bombing_Marienburg.JPEG/250px-8th_AF_Bombing_Marienburg.JPEG)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:8th_AF_Bombing_Marienburg.JPEG)

American [Eighth Air Force](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eighth_Air_Force "Eighth Air Force")[Boeing B-17 Flying Fortress](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boeing_B-17_Flying_Fortress "Boeing B-17 Flying Fortress") bombing raid on the Focke-Wulf factory in Germany, 9 October 1943

Exploiting poor American naval command decisions, [the German navy ravaged Allied shipping off the American Atlantic coast](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Second_Happy_Time "Second Happy Time").[[222]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEMilner199052-225) By November 1941, Commonwealth forces had launched a counter-offensive in North Africa, [Operation Crusader](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Crusader "Operation Crusader"), and reclaimed all the gains the Germans and Italians had made.[[223]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBeevor2012224%E2%80%93228-226) The Germans also launched a North African offensive in January, pushing the British back to positions at the [Gazala line](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Gazala#Gazala_line "Battle of Gazala") by early February,[[224]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEMolinari200791-227) followed by a temporary lull in combat which Germany used to prepare for their upcoming offensives.[[225]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEMitcham200731-228) Concerns that the Japanese might use bases in [Vichy-held Madagascar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/French_Madagascar "French Madagascar") caused the British to [invade the island](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Madagascar "Battle of Madagascar") in early May 1942.[[226]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBeevor2012380%E2%80%93381-229) An Axis [offensive in Libya](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Gazala "Battle of Gazala") forced an Allied retreat deep inside Egypt until Axis forces were [stopped at El Alamein](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/First_Battle_of_El_Alamein "First Battle of El Alamein").[[227]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTERich1992178-230) On the Continent, raids of Allied [commandos](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Commando "Commando") on strategic targets, culminating in the failed [Dieppe Raid](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dieppe_Raid "Dieppe Raid"),[[228]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEGordon2004129-231) demonstrated the Western Allies' inability to launch an invasion of continental Europe without much better preparation, equipment, and operational security.[[229]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTENeillands200560-232)

In August 1942, the Allies succeeded in repelling a [second attack against El Alamein](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Alam_el_Halfa "Battle of Alam el Halfa")[[230]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEKeegan1997277-233) and, at a high cost, managed to [deliver desperately needed supplies to the besieged Malta](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Pedestal "Operation Pedestal").[[231]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTESmith2002-234) A few months later, the Allies [commenced an attack of their own](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Second_Battle_of_El_Alamein "Second Battle of El Alamein") in Egypt, dislodging the Axis forces and beginning a drive west across Libya.[[232]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEThomasAndrew19988-235) This attack was followed up shortly after by [Anglo-American landings in French North Africa](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Torch "Operation Torch"), which resulted in the region joining the Allies.[[233]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTERoss199738-236) Hitler responded to the French colony's defection by ordering the [occupation of Vichy France](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Case_Anton "Case Anton");[[233]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTERoss199738-236) although Vichy forces did not resist this violation of the armistice, they managed to [scuttle their fleet](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scuttling_of_the_French_fleet_at_Toulon "Scuttling of the French fleet at Toulon") to prevent its capture by German forces.[[233]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTERoss199738-236)[[234]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBonnerBonner200124-237) Axis forces in Africa withdrew into [Tunisia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tunisia "Tunisia"), which was [conquered by the Allies](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tunisian_campaign "Tunisian campaign") in May 1943.[[233]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTERoss199738-236)[[235]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTECollier200311-238)

In June 1943, the British and Americans began [a strategic bombing campaign](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Combined_Bomber_Offensive "Combined Bomber Offensive") against Germany with a goal to disrupt the war economy, reduce morale, and "[de-house](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dehousing "Dehousing")" the civilian population.[[236]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-239) The [firebombing of Hamburg](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bombing_of_Hamburg_in_World_War_II "Bombing of Hamburg in World War II") was among the first attacks in this campaign, inflicting significant casualties and considerable losses on infrastructure of this important industrial centre.[[237]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEOvery1995119%E2%80%93120-240)

triples.sentence: Exploiting poor American naval command decisions, [the German navy ravaged Allied shipping off the American Atlantic coast](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Second_Happy_Time "Second Happy Time").[[222]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEMilner199052-225)
triples.statement: Taking advantage of poor American naval command decisions, the German navy attacked Allied shipping off the American Atlantic coast.

triples.sentence: By November 1941, Commonwealth forces had launched a counter-offensive in North Africa, [Operation Crusader](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Crusader "Operation Crusader"), and reclaimed all the gains the Germans and Italians had made.[[223]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBeevor2012224%E2%80%93228-226)
triples.statement: By November 1941, Commonwealth forces initiated a counter-offensive in North Africa, Operation Crusader, and regained all territory previously taken by the Germans and Italians.

triples.sentence: The Germans also launched a North African offensive in January, pushing the British back to positions at the [Gazala line](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Gazala#Gazala_line "Battle of Gazala") by early February,[[224]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEMolinari200791-227) followed by a temporary lull in combat which Germany used to prepare for their upcoming offensives.[[225]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEMitcham200731-228)
triples.statement: In January, the Germans began a North African offensive that pushed the British back to the Gazala line by early February, which was followed by a lull in combat as Germany prepared for future offensives.

triples.sentence: Concerns that the Japanese might use bases in [Vichy-held Madagascar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/French_Madagascar "French Madagascar") caused the British to [invade the island](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Madagascar "Battle of Madagascar") in early May 1942.[[226]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBeevor2012380%E2%80%93381-229)
triples.statement: In early May 1942, the British invaded Vichy-held Madagascar over concerns that the Japanese might use bases there.

triples.sentence: An Axis [offensive in Libya](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Gazala "Battle of Gazala") forced an Allied retreat deep inside Egypt until Axis forces were [stopped at El Alamein](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/First_Battle_of_El_Alamein "First Battle of El Alamein").[[227]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTERich1992178-230)
triples.statement: An Axis offensive in Libya compelled an Allied retreat into Egypt until Axis forces were halted at El Alamein.

triples.sentence: On the Continent, raids of Allied [commandos](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Commando "Commando") on strategic targets, culminating in the failed [Dieppe Raid](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dieppe_Raid "Dieppe Raid"),[[228]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEGordon2004129-231) demonstrated the Western Allies' inability to launch an invasion of continental Europe without much better preparation, equipment, and operational security.[[229]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTENeillands200560-232)
triples.statement: Allied commando raids on strategic targets in Europe, which included the unsuccessful Dieppe Raid, highlighted the Western Allies' lack of readiness for a full-scale invasion of the continent.

triples.sentence: In August 1942, the Allies succeeded in repelling a [second attack against El Alamein](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Alam_el_Halfa "Battle of Alam el Halfa")[[230]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEKeegan1997277-233) and, at a high cost, managed to [deliver desperately needed supplies to the besieged Malta](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Pedestal "Operation Pedestal").[[231]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTESmith2002-234)
triples.statement: In August 1942, the Allies successfully repelled a second attack on El Alamein and, despite high costs, delivered essential supplies to the besieged island of Malta.

triples.sentence: A few months later, the Allies [commenced an attack of their own](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Second_Battle_of_El_Alamein "Second Battle of El Alamein") in Egypt, dislodging the Axis forces and beginning a drive west across Libya.[[232]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEThomasAndrew19988-235)
triples.statement: A few months later, the Allies launched their own attack in Egypt, which displaced Axis forces and started a westward advance across Libya.

triples.sentence: This attack was followed up shortly after by [Anglo-American landings in French North Africa](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Torch "Operation Torch"), which resulted in the region joining the Allies.[[233]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTERoss199738-236)
triples.statement: This was soon followed by Anglo-American landings in French North Africa, leading to the region aligning with the Allies.

triples.sentence: Hitler responded to the French colony's defection by ordering the [occupation of Vichy France](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Case_Anton "Case Anton");[[233]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTERoss199738-236) although Vichy forces did not resist this violation of the armistice, they managed to [scuttle their fleet](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scuttling_of_the_French_fleet_at_Toulon "Scuttling of the French fleet at Toulon") to prevent its capture by German forces.[[233]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTERoss199738-236)[[234]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBonnerBonner200124-237)
triples.statement: In response to the French colony's change of allegiance, Hitler ordered the occupation of Vichy France; while Vichy forces did not resist, they scuttled their fleet to keep it from being captured by German forces.

triples.sentence: Axis forces in Africa withdrew into [Tunisia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tunisia "Tunisia"), which was [conquered by the Allies](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tunisian_campaign "Tunisian campaign") in May 1943.[[233]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTERoss199738-236)[[235]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTECollier200311-238)
triples.statement: Axis forces in Africa retreated into Tunisia, which was subsequently conquered by the Allies in May 1943.

triples.sentence: The [firebombing of Hamburg](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bombing_of_Hamburg_in_World_War_II "Bombing of Hamburg in World War II") was among the first attacks in this campaign, inflicting significant casualties and considerable losses on infrastructure of this important industrial centre.[[237]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEOvery1995119%E2%80%93120-240)
triples.statement: The firebombing of Hamburg was one of the initial attacks in this campaign, causing major casualties and significant damage to the infrastructure of the industrial center.

section_body:
[![Image 36](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/07/SBD_VB-16_over_USS_Washington_1943.jpg/250px-SBD_VB-16_over_USS_Washington_1943.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:SBD_VB-16_over_USS_Washington_1943.jpg)

[US Navy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Navy "United States Navy")[SBD-5](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Douglas_SBD_Dauntless "Douglas SBD Dauntless")[scout plane](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scout_plane "Scout plane") flying patrol over [USS _Washington_](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Washington_(BB-56) "USS Washington (BB-56)") and [USS _Lexington_](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Lexington_(CV-16) "USS Lexington (CV-16)") during the [Gilbert and Marshall Islands campaign](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gilbert_and_Marshall_Islands_campaign "Gilbert and Marshall Islands campaign"), 1943

After the Guadalcanal campaign, the Allies initiated several operations against Japan in the Pacific. In May 1943, Canadian and US forces were sent to [eliminate Japanese forces from the Aleutians](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aleutian_Islands_campaign#Allied_response "Aleutian Islands campaign").[[238]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEThompsonRandall2008164-241) Soon after, the United States, with support from Australia, New Zealand and Pacific Islander forces, began major ground, sea and air operations to [isolate Rabaul by capturing surrounding islands](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Cartwheel "Operation Cartwheel"), and [breach the Japanese Central Pacific perimeter at the Gilbert and Marshall Islands](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gilbert_and_Marshall_Islands_campaign "Gilbert and Marshall Islands campaign").[[239]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEKennedy2001610-242) By the end of March 1944, the Allies had completed both of these objectives and had also [neutralised the major Japanese base at Truk](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Hailstone "Operation Hailstone") in the [Caroline Islands](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Caroline_Islands "Caroline Islands"). In April, the Allies launched an operation to [retake Western New Guinea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Western_New_Guinea_campaign "Western New Guinea campaign").[[240]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTERottman2002228-243)

In the Soviet Union, both the Germans and the Soviets spent the spring and early summer of 1943 preparing for large offensives in [central Russia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Central_Russia "Central Russia"). On 5 July 1943, Germany [attacked Soviet forces around the Kursk Bulge](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Kursk "Battle of Kursk"). Within a week, German forces had exhausted themselves against the Soviets' well-constructed defences,[[241]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-244) and for the first time in the war, Hitler cancelled an operation before it had achieved tactical or operational success.[[242]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEKershaw2001592-245) This decision was partially affected by the Western Allies' [invasion of Sicily](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Allied_invasion_of_Sicily "Allied invasion of Sicily") launched on 9 July, which, combined with previous Italian failures, resulted in the [ousting and arrest of Mussolini](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fall_of_the_Fascist_regime_in_Italy "Fall of the Fascist regime in Italy") later that month.[[243]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEO'Reilly200132-246)

On 12 July 1943, the Soviets launched their own [counter-offensives](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Kutuzov "Operation Kutuzov"), thereby nearly completely dispelling any chance of German victory or even stalemate in the east. The Soviet victory at Kursk marked the end of German superiority,[[244]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBellamy2007595-247) giving the Soviet Union the initiative on the Eastern Front.[[245]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEO'Reilly200135-248)[[246]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEHealy199290-249) The Germans tried to stabilise their eastern front along the hastily fortified [Panther–Wotan line](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Panther%E2%80%93Wotan_line "Panther–Wotan line"), but the Soviets broke through it at [Smolensk](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Smolensk_operation "Smolensk operation") and the [Lower Dnieper Offensive](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_the_Dnieper "Battle of the Dnieper").[[247]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEGlantz200150%E2%80%9355-250)

On 3 September 1943, the Western Allies [invaded the Italian mainland](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Allied_invasion_of_Italy "Allied invasion of Italy"), following [Italy's armistice with the Allies](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Armistice_of_Cassibile "Armistice of Cassibile") and the ensuing German occupation of Italy.[[248]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-251) Germany, with the help of the fascists, responded to the armistice by [disarming Italian forces](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Achse "Operation Achse") that were in many places without superior orders, seizing military control of Italian areas,[[249]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEMazower2008362-252) and creating a series of defensive lines.[[250]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEHartHartHughes2000151-253) German special forces then [rescued Mussolini](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gran_Sasso_raid "Gran Sasso raid"), who then soon established a new client state in German-occupied Italy named the [Italian Social Republic](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Italian_Social_Republic "Italian Social Republic"),[[251]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBlinkhorn200652-254) causing an [Italian civil war](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Italian_Civil_War "Italian Civil War"). The Western Allies fought through several lines until reaching the [main German defensive line](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Winter_Line "Winter Line") in mid-November.[[252]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEReadFisher2002129-255)

[![Image 37](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/76/Soviet_troops_and_T-34_tanks_counterattacking_Kursk_Voronezh_Front_July_1943.jpg/250px-Soviet_troops_and_T-34_tanks_counterattacking_Kursk_Voronezh_Front_July_1943.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Soviet_troops_and_T-34_tanks_counterattacking_Kursk_Voronezh_Front_July_1943.jpg)

[Red Army](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Red_Army "Red Army") troops in a counter-offensive on German positions at the [Battle of Kursk](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Kursk "Battle of Kursk"), July 1943

German operations in the Atlantic also suffered. By [May 1943, as Allied counter-measures became increasingly effective](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Black_May_(1943) "Black May (1943)"), the resulting sizeable German submarine losses forced a temporary halt of the German Atlantic naval campaign.[[253]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-256) In November 1943, [Franklin D. Roosevelt](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Franklin_D._Roosevelt "Franklin D. Roosevelt") and Winston Churchill met with [Chiang Kai-shek](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chiang_Kai-shek "Chiang Kai-shek")[in Cairo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cairo_Conference "Cairo Conference") and then with Joseph Stalin [in Tehran](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tehran_Conference "Tehran Conference").[[254]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Kolko_1990_211,235,267_268-257) The former conference determined the post-war return of Japanese territory[[255]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Iriye_1981_154-258) and the military planning for the [Burma campaign](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Burma_campaign "Burma campaign"),[[256]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEMitter2014286-259) while the latter included agreement that the Western Allies would invade Europe in 1944 and that the Soviet Union would declare war on Japan within three months of Germany's defeat.[[257]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-polley148-260)

From November 1943, during the seven-week [Battle of Changde](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Changde "Battle of Changde"), the Chinese awaited Allied relief as they forced Japan to fight a costly war of attrition.[[258]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Beevor_2012_268_274-261)[[259]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-H161-262)[[260]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Hsu_Chang_412-416-263) In January 1944, the Allies launched a [series of attacks in Italy against the line at Monte Cassino](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Monte_Cassino "Battle of Monte Cassino") and tried to outflank it with [landings at Anzio](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Anzio "Battle of Anzio").[[261]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-264)

On 27 January 1944, [Soviet](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leningrad_Front "Leningrad Front") troops launched [a major offensive](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Siege_of_Leningrad#Soviet_relief_of_the_siege "Siege of Leningrad") that expelled German forces from the [Leningrad region](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leningrad_Oblast "Leningrad Oblast"), thereby ending the [most lethal siege in history](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_battles_by_casualties#Sieges_and_urban_combat "List of battles by casualties").[[262]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Glantz_2002_327_366-265) The [following Soviet offensive](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leningrad%E2%80%93Novgorod_offensive "Leningrad–Novgorod offensive") was [halted on the pre-war Estonian border](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Narva_(1944) "Battle of Narva (1944)") by the German [Army Group North](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Army_Group_North "Army Group North") aided by [Estonians](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/German_occupation_of_Estonia_during_World_War_II#Estonians_in_Nazi_German_military_units "German occupation of Estonia during World War II") hoping to [re-establish national independence](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Estonian_government-in-exile#Failure_to_reestablish_independence "Estonian government-in-exile"). This delay slowed subsequent Soviet operations in the [Baltic Sea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Baltic_Sea "Baltic Sea") region.[[263]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Glantz_2002_367_414-266) By late May 1944, the Soviets had [liberated Crimea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crimean_offensive "Crimean offensive"), [largely expelled Axis forces from Ukraine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dnieper%E2%80%93Carpathian_offensive "Dnieper–Carpathian offensive"), and made [incursions into Romania](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/First_Jassy%E2%80%93Kishinev_offensive "First Jassy–Kishinev offensive"), which were repulsed by the Axis troops.[[264]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Chubarov_2001_122-267) The Allied offensives in Italy had succeeded and, at the cost of allowing several German divisions to retreat, Rome was captured on 4 June.[[265]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-268)

The Allies had mixed success in mainland Asia. In March 1944, the Japanese launched the first of two invasions, [an operation against Allied positions in Assam, India](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_U-Go "Operation U-Go"),[[266]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Lightbody_2004_224-269) and soon besieged Commonwealth positions at [Imphal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Imphal "Battle of Imphal") and [Kohima](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Kohima "Battle of Kohima").[[267]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Zeiler-270) In May 1944, British and Indian forces mounted a counter-offensive that drove Japanese troops back to Burma by July,[[267]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Zeiler-270) and Chinese forces that had [invaded northern Burma](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Northern_Burma_and_Western_Yunnan "Battle of Northern Burma and Western Yunnan") in late 1943 [besieged Japanese troops](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Siege_of_Myitkyina "Siege of Myitkyina") in [Myitkyina](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Myitkyina "Myitkyina").[[268]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-271) The [second Japanese invasion](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Ichi-Go "Operation Ichi-Go") of China aimed to destroy China's main fighting forces, secure railways between Japanese-held territory and capture Allied airfields.[[269]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-272) By June, the Japanese had conquered the province of [Henan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Henan "Henan") and begun a [new attack on Changsha](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Changsha_(1944) "Battle of Changsha (1944)").[[270]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-273)

triples.statement: The Germans attempted to stabilize their eastern front along the Panther–Wotan line, but the Soviets breached it at Smolensk and during the Lower Dnieper Offensive.

triples.sentence: On 3 September 1943, the Western Allies [invaded the Italian mainland](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Allied_invasion_of_Italy "Allied invasion of Italy"), following [Italy's armistice with the Allies](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Armistice_of_Cassibile "Armistice of Cassibile") and the ensuing German occupation of Italy.[[248]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-251)
triples.statement: On September 3, 1943, the Western Allies invaded the Italian mainland, following Italy's armistice with the Allies and the subsequent German occupation of Italy.

triples.sentence: Germany, with the help of the fascists, responded to the armistice by [disarming Italian forces](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Achse "Operation Achse") that were in many places without superior orders, seizing military control of Italian areas,[[249]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEMazower2008362-252) and creating a series of defensive lines.[[250]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEHartHartHughes2000151-253)
triples.statement: With fascist assistance, Germany responded to the armistice by disarming Italian forces, seizing military control of Italian areas, and establishing a series of defensive lines.

triples.sentence: German special forces then [rescued Mussolini](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gran_Sasso_raid "Gran Sasso raid"), who then soon established a new client state in German-occupied Italy named the [Italian Social Republic](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Italian_Social_Republic "Italian Social Republic"),[[251]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBlinkhorn200652-254) causing an [Italian civil war](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Italian_Civil_War "Italian Civil War").
triples.statement: German special forces rescued Mussolini, who then established the Italian Social Republic, a new client state in German-occupied Italy, sparking an Italian civil war.

triples.sentence: The Western Allies fought through several lines until reaching the [main German defensive line](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Winter_Line "Winter Line") in mid-November.[[252]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEReadFisher2002129-255)
triples.statement: By mid-November, the Western Allies had fought through several lines to reach the main German defensive line.

triples.sentence: By [May 1943, as Allied counter-measures became increasingly effective](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Black_May_(1943) "Black May (1943)"), the resulting sizeable German submarine losses forced a temporary halt of the German Atlantic naval campaign.[[253]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-256)
triples.statement: By May 1943, significant German submarine losses due to increasingly effective Allied counter-measures forced a temporary halt to the German Atlantic naval campaign.

triples.sentence: In November 1943, [Franklin D. Roosevelt](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Franklin_D._Roosevelt "Franklin D. Roosevelt") and Winston Churchill met with [Chiang Kai-shek](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chiang_Kai-shek "Chiang Kai-shek")[in Cairo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cairo_Conference "Cairo Conference") and then with Joseph Stalin [in Tehran](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tehran_Conference "Tehran Conference").[[254]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Kolko_1990_211,235,267_268-257)
triples.statement: In November 1943, Franklin D. Roosevelt and Winston Churchill met with Chiang Kai-shek in Cairo and subsequently with Joseph Stalin in Tehran.

triples.sentence: The former conference determined the post-war return of Japanese territory[[255]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Iriye_1981_154-258) and the military planning for the [Burma campaign](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Burma_campaign "Burma campaign"),[[256]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEMitter2014286-259) while the latter included agreement that the Western Allies would invade Europe in 1944 and that the Soviet Union would declare war on Japan within three months of Germany's defeat.[[257]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-polley148-260)
triples.statement: The Cairo Conference determined the post-war return of Japanese territory and planned the Burma campaign, while the Tehran Conference resulted in an agreement for a 1944 Western Allied invasion of Europe and a Soviet declaration of war on Japan within three months of Germany's defeat.

triples.sentence: From November 1943, during the seven-week [Battle of Changde](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Changde "Battle of Changde"), the Chinese awaited Allied relief as they forced Japan to fight a costly war of attrition.[[258]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Beevor_2012_268_274-261)[[259]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-H161-262)[[260]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Hsu_Chang_412-416-263)
triples.statement: Beginning in November 1943, during the seven-week Battle of Changde, the Chinese engaged Japan in a costly war of attrition while awaiting Allied relief.

triples.sentence: In January 1944, the Allies launched a [series of attacks in Italy against the line at Monte Cassino](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Monte_Cassino "Battle of Monte Cassino") and tried to outflank it with [landings at Anzio](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Anzio "Battle of Anzio").[[261]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-264)
triples.statement: In January 1944, the Allies initiated a series of attacks in Italy against the line at Monte Cassino and attempted to outflank it with landings at Anzio.

triples.sentence: On 27 January 1944, [Soviet](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leningrad_Front "Leningrad Front") troops launched [a major offensive](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Siege_of_Leningrad#Soviet_relief_of_the_siege "Siege of Leningrad") that expelled German forces from the [Leningrad region](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leningrad_Oblast "Leningrad Oblast"), thereby ending the [most lethal siege in history](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_battles_by_casualties#Sieges_and_urban_combat "List of battles by casualties").[[262]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Glantz_2002_327_366-265)
triples.statement: On January 27, 1944, Soviet troops launched a major offensive that drove German forces from the Leningrad region, ending the most lethal siege in history.

triples.sentence: This delay slowed subsequent Soviet operations in the [Baltic Sea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Baltic_Sea "Baltic Sea") region.[[263]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Glantz_2002_367_414-266)
triples.statement: This delay slowed later Soviet operations in the Baltic Sea region.

triples.sentence: By late May 1944, the Soviets had [liberated Crimea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crimean_offensive "Crimean offensive"), [largely expelled Axis forces from Ukraine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dnieper%E2%80%93Carpathian_offensive "Dnieper–Carpathian offensive"), and made [incursions into Romania](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/First_Jassy%E2%80%93Kishinev_offensive "First Jassy–Kishinev offensive"), which were repulsed by the Axis troops.[[264]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Chubarov_2001_122-267)
triples.statement: By late May 1944, the Soviets had liberated Crimea, expelled most Axis forces from Ukraine, and made incursions into Romania that were repelled by Axis troops.

triples.sentence: The Allied offensives in Italy had succeeded and, at the cost of allowing several German divisions to retreat, Rome was captured on 4 June.[[265]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-268)
triples.statement: The Allied offensives in Italy were successful, and Rome was captured on June 4, though at the cost of allowing several German divisions to retreat.

triples.sentence: In March 1944, the Japanese launched the first of two invasions, [an operation against Allied positions in Assam, India](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_U-Go "Operation U-Go"),[[266]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Lightbody_2004_224-269) and soon besieged Commonwealth positions at [Imphal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Imphal "Battle of Imphal") and [Kohima](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Kohima "Battle of Kohima").[[267]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Zeiler-270)
triples.statement: In March 1944, the Japanese initiated the first of two invasions, an operation targeting Allied positions in Assam, India, which soon led to the siege of Commonwealth positions at Imphal and Kohima.

triples.sentence: In May 1944, British and Indian forces mounted a counter-offensive that drove Japanese troops back to Burma by July,[[267]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Zeiler-270) and Chinese forces that had [invaded northern Burma](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Northern_Burma_and_Western_Yunnan "Battle of Northern Burma and Western Yunnan") in late 1943 [besieged Japanese troops](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Siege_of_Myitkyina "Siege of Myitkyina") in [Myitkyina](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Myitkyina "Myitkyina").[[268]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-271)
triples.statement: In May 1944, British and Indian forces launched a counter-offensive that pushed Japanese troops back to Burma by July, while Chinese forces that had invaded northern Burma in late 1943 besieged Japanese troops in Myitkyina.

triples.sentence: The [second Japanese invasion](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Ichi-Go "Operation Ichi-Go") of China aimed to destroy China's main fighting forces, secure railways between Japanese-held territory and capture Allied airfields.[[269]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-272)
triples.statement: The second Japanese invasion of China aimed to destroy China's main fighting forces, secure railways between Japanese-held territories, and capture Allied airfields.

triples.sentence: By June, the Japanese had conquered the province of [Henan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Henan "Henan") and begun a [new attack on Changsha](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Changsha_(1944) "Battle of Changsha (1944)").[[270]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-273)
triples.statement: By June, the Japanese had conquered Henan province and launched a new attack on Changsha.

section_body:
[![Image 38](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/96/Approaching_Omaha.jpg/250px-Approaching_Omaha.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Approaching_Omaha.jpg)

American troops approaching [Omaha Beach](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Omaha_Beach "Omaha Beach") during the [invasion of Normandy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Overlord "Operation Overlord") on [D-Day](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Normandy_landings "Normandy landings"), 6 June 1944

On 6 June 1944 (commonly known as [D-Day](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Normandy_landings "Normandy landings")), after three years of Soviet pressure,[[271]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-rees406-274) the Western Allies [invaded northern France](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Overlord "Operation Overlord"). After reassigning several Allied divisions from Italy, they also [attacked southern France](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Dragoon "Operation Dragoon").[[272]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Weinberg_2005_695-275) These landings were successful and led to the defeat of the [German Army units in France](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Falaise_pocket "Falaise pocket"). [Paris](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paris "Paris") was [liberated](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Liberation_of_Paris "Liberation of Paris") on 25 August by the [local resistance](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/French_Resistance "French Resistance") assisted by the [Free French Forces](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Free_French_Forces "Free French Forces"), both led by General [Charles de Gaulle](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_de_Gaulle "Charles de Gaulle"),[[273]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-276) and the Western Allies continued to [push back German forces](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Siegfried_Line_campaign "Siegfried Line campaign") in western Europe during the latter part of the year. An attempt to advance into northern Germany spearheaded by [a major airborne operation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Market_Garden "Operation Market Garden") in the Netherlands failed.[[274]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-277) After that, the Western Allies slowly pushed into Germany, but [failed to cross the Roer river](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Queen "Operation Queen"). In Italy, the Allied advance slowed due to the [last major German defensive line](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gothic_Line "Gothic Line").[[275]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-278)

On 22 June, the Soviets launched [a strategic offensive in Belarus](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Bagration "Operation Bagration") that nearly destroyed the German [Army Group Centre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Army_Group_Centre "Army Group Centre").[[276]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Zaloga_1996_7-279) Soon after that, [another Soviet strategic offensive](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lvov%E2%80%93Sandomierz_offensive "Lvov–Sandomierz offensive") forced German troops from Western Ukraine and Eastern Poland. The Soviet Red Army however halted in the [Praga](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Praga "Praga") district on the other side of the [Vistula](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vistula "Vistula") and watched passively as the Germans quelled the [Warsaw Uprising](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Warsaw_Uprising "Warsaw Uprising") initiated by the [Home Army](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Home_Army "Home Army") (the main faction of the [Polish resistance](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Polish_resistance_movement_in_World_War_II "Polish resistance movement in World War II"), loyal to the non-communist government-in exile).[[277]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-280) The [national uprising](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Slovak_National_Uprising "Slovak National Uprising") in [Slovakia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Slovak_Republic_(1939%E2%80%931945) "Slovak Republic (1939–1945)") was also quelled by the Germans.[[278]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-281) The Soviet [Red Army](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Red_Army "Red Army")'s [strategic offensive in eastern Romania](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Second_Jassy%E2%80%93Kishinev_offensive "Second Jassy–Kishinev offensive") cut off and destroyed the [considerable German troops there](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Army_Group_South_Ukraine "Army Group South Ukraine") and triggered [a successful coup d'état in Romania](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1944_Romanian_coup_d%27%C3%A9tat "1944 Romanian coup d'état") and [in Bulgaria](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1944_Bulgarian_coup_d%27%C3%A9tat "1944 Bulgarian coup d'état"), followed by those countries' shift to the Allied side.[[279]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-countrystudies.us-282)

[![Image 39](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0e/Douglas_MacArthur_lands_Leyte1.jpg/250px-Douglas_MacArthur_lands_Leyte1.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Douglas_MacArthur_lands_Leyte1.jpg)

[General](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/General_(United_States) "General (United States)")[Douglas MacArthur](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Douglas_MacArthur "Douglas MacArthur") returns to the [Philippines](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Commonwealth_of_the_Philippines "Commonwealth of the Philippines") during the [Battle of Leyte](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Leyte "Battle of Leyte"), 20 October 1944

In September 1944, Soviet troops advanced into [Yugoslavia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Democratic_Federal_Yugoslavia "Democratic Federal Yugoslavia") and forced the rapid withdrawal of German Army Groups [E](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Army_Group_E "Army Group E") and [F](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Army_Group_F "Army Group F") in [Greece](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Axis_occupation_of_Greece "Axis occupation of Greece"), [Albania](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/German_occupation_of_Albania "German occupation of Albania"), and Yugoslavia to rescue them from being cut off.[[280]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Evans_2008_653-283) By this point, the communist-led [Partisans](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yugoslav_Partisans "Yugoslav Partisans") under Marshal [Josip Broz Tito](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Josip_Broz_Tito "Josip Broz Tito"), who had led an [increasingly successful guerrilla campaign](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II_in_Yugoslavia "World War II in Yugoslavia") against the occupation since 1941, controlled much of the territory of Yugoslavia and engaged in delaying efforts against German forces further south. In northern [Serbia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Territory_of_the_Military_Commander_in_Serbia "Territory of the Military Commander in Serbia"), the Soviet [Red Army](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Red_Army "Red Army"), with limited support from Bulgarian forces, assisted the Partisans in a joint [liberation of the capital city of Belgrade](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Belgrade_offensive "Belgrade offensive") on 20 October. A few days later, the Soviets launched a [massive assault](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Budapest_offensive "Budapest offensive") against [German-occupied](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Panzerfaust "Operation Panzerfaust") Hungary that lasted until [the fall of Budapest](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Siege_of_Budapest "Siege of Budapest") in February 1945.[[281]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-284) Unlike impressive Soviet victories in the Balkans, [bitter Finnish resistance](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Continuation_War "Continuation War") to the [Soviet offensive](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vyborg%E2%80%93Petrozavodsk_offensive "Vyborg–Petrozavodsk offensive") in the [Karelian Isthmus](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Karelian_Isthmus "Karelian Isthmus") denied the Soviets occupation of Finland and led to a [Soviet-Finnish armistice](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moscow_Armistice "Moscow Armistice") on relatively mild conditions,[[282]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-285) although Finland was forced to [fight their German former allies](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lapland_War "Lapland War").[[283]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEShirer19901085-286)

By the start of July 1944, Commonwealth forces in Southeast Asia had repelled the Japanese sieges in [Assam](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Assam "Assam"), pushing the Japanese back to the [Chindwin River](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chindwin_River "Chindwin River")[[284]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Marston_2005_120-287) while the Chinese captured Myitkyina. In September 1944, Chinese forces [captured Mount Song](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Mount_Song "Battle of Mount Song") and reopened the [Burma Road](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Burma_Road "Burma Road").[[285]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-288) In China, the Japanese had more successes, having finally [captured Changsha](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Changsha_(1944) "Battle of Changsha (1944)") in mid-June and the city of [Hengyang](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Hengyang "Battle of Hengyang") by early August.[[286]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-289) Soon after, they invaded the province of [Guangxi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guangxi "Guangxi"), winning major engagements against Chinese forces at [Guilin and Liuzhou](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Guilin%E2%80%93Liuzhou "Battle of Guilin–Liuzhou") by the end of November[[287]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-290) and successfully linking up their forces in China and Indochina by mid-December.[[288]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Drea_2003_54-291)

In the Pacific, US forces continued to push back the Japanese perimeter. In mid-June 1944, they began their [offensive against the Mariana and Palau islands](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mariana_and_Palau_Islands_campaign "Mariana and Palau Islands campaign") and decisively defeated Japanese forces in the [Battle of the Philippine Sea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_the_Philippine_Sea "Battle of the Philippine Sea"). These defeats led to the resignation of the Japanese Prime Minister, [Hideki Tojo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hideki_Tojo "Hideki Tojo"), and provided the United States with air bases to launch intensive heavy bomber attacks on the Japanese home islands. In late October, American forces [invaded the Filipino island of Leyte](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Leyte "Battle of Leyte"); soon after, Allied naval forces scored another large victory in the [Battle of Leyte Gulf](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Leyte_Gulf "Battle of Leyte Gulf"), one of the largest naval battles in history.[[289]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-292)

triples.sentence: Unlike impressive Soviet victories in the Balkans, [bitter Finnish resistance](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Continuation_War "Continuation War") to the [Soviet offensive](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vyborg%E2%80%93Petrozavodsk_offensive "Vyborg–Petrozavodsk offensive") in the [Karelian Isthmus](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Karelian_Isthmus "Karelian Isthmus") denied the Soviets occupation of Finland and led to a [Soviet-Finnish armistice](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moscow_Armistice "Moscow Armistice") on relatively mild conditions,[[282]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-285) although Finland was forced to [fight their German former allies](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lapland_War "Lapland War").[[283]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEShirer19901085-286)
triples.statement: In contrast to Soviet victories in the Balkans, strong Finnish resistance to a Soviet offensive in the Karelian Isthmus prevented a Soviet occupation of Finland, leading to a Soviet-Finnish armistice on relatively mild terms, though Finland was required to fight its former German allies.

triples.sentence: By the start of July 1944, Commonwealth forces in Southeast Asia had repelled the Japanese sieges in [Assam](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Assam "Assam"), pushing the Japanese back to the [Chindwin River](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chindwin_River "Chindwin River")[[284]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Marston_2005_120-287) while the Chinese captured Myitkyina.
triples.statement: By the start of July 1944, Commonwealth forces in Southeast Asia had repelled Japanese sieges in Assam, pushing them back to the Chindwin River, while Chinese forces captured Myitkyina.

triples.sentence: In September 1944, Chinese forces [captured Mount Song](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Mount_Song "Battle of Mount Song") and reopened the [Burma Road](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Burma_Road "Burma Road").[[285]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-288)
triples.statement: In September 1944, Chinese forces captured Mount Song and reopened the Burma Road.

triples.sentence: In China, the Japanese had more successes, having finally [captured Changsha](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Changsha_(1944) "Battle of Changsha (1944)") in mid-June and the city of [Hengyang](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Hengyang "Battle of Hengyang") by early August.[[286]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-289)
triples.statement: In China, the Japanese had more successes, capturing Changsha in mid-June and the city of Hengyang by early August.

triples.sentence: Soon after, they invaded the province of [Guangxi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guangxi "Guangxi"), winning major engagements against Chinese forces at [Guilin and Liuzhou](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Guilin%E2%80%93Liuzhou "Battle of Guilin–Liuzhou") by the end of November[[287]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-290) and successfully linking up their forces in China and Indochina by mid-December.[[288]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Drea_2003_54-291)
triples.statement: Soon after, Japanese forces invaded Guangxi province, won major battles against Chinese forces at Guilin and Liuzhou by the end of November, and successfully linked their forces in China and Indochina by mid-December.

triples.sentence: In late October, American forces [invaded the Filipino island of Leyte](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Leyte "Battle of Leyte"); soon after, Allied naval forces scored another large victory in the [Battle of Leyte Gulf](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Leyte_Gulf "Battle of Leyte Gulf"), one of the largest naval battles in history.[[289]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-292)
triples.statement: In late October, American forces invaded the Filipino island of Leyte; soon after, Allied naval forces achieved a major victory in the Battle of Leyte Gulf, one of the largest naval battles in history.

section_body:
[![Image 40](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/05/Yalta_Conference_%28Churchill%2C_Roosevelt%2C_Stalin%29_%28B%26W%29.jpg/250px-Yalta_Conference_%28Churchill%2C_Roosevelt%2C_Stalin%29_%28B%26W%29.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Yalta_Conference_(Churchill,_Roosevelt,_Stalin)_(B%26W).jpg)

[Yalta Conference](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yalta_Conference "Yalta Conference") held in February 1945, with [Winston Churchill](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Winston_Churchill "Winston Churchill"), [Franklin D. Roosevelt](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Franklin_D._Roosevelt "Franklin D. Roosevelt"), and [Joseph Stalin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joseph_Stalin "Joseph Stalin")

On 16 December 1944, Germany made a last attempt to split the Allies on the Western Front by using most of its remaining reserves to launch [a massive counter-offensive in the Ardennes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_the_Bulge "Battle of the Bulge") and [along the French-German border](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Northwind_(1944) "Operation Northwind (1944)"), hoping to encircle large portions of Western Allied troops and prompt a political settlement after capturing their primary supply port at [Antwerp](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Antwerp "Antwerp"). By 16 January 1945, this offensive had been repulsed with no strategic objectives fulfilled.[[290]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-parkerxiii-293) In Italy, the Western Allies remained stalemated at the German defensive line. In mid-January 1945, the Red Army attacked in Poland, [pushing from the Vistula to the Oder](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vistula%E2%80%93Oder_offensive "Vistula–Oder offensive") river in Germany, and [overran East Prussia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/East_Prussian_offensive "East Prussian offensive").[[291]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-294) On 4 February Soviet, British, and US leaders met for the [Yalta Conference](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yalta_Conference "Yalta Conference"). They agreed on the occupation of post-war Germany, and on when the Soviet Union would join the war against Japan.[[292]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-295)

In February, the Soviets [entered Silesia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Silesian_offensives "Silesian offensives") and [Pomerania](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/East_Pomeranian_offensive "East Pomeranian offensive"), while the [Western Allies entered western Germany](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Western_Allied_invasion_of_Germany "Western Allied invasion of Germany") and closed to the [Rhine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rhine "Rhine") river. By March, the Western Allies crossed the Rhine [north](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Plunder "Operation Plunder") and [south](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Remagen "Remagen") of the [Ruhr](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ruhr_(river) "Ruhr (river)"), [encircling the German Army Group B](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ruhr_pocket "Ruhr pocket").[[293]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-296) In early March, in an attempt to protect its last oil reserves in Hungary and retake Budapest, Germany launched [its last major offensive](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Spring_Awakening "Operation Spring Awakening") against Soviet troops near [Lake Balaton](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lake_Balaton "Lake Balaton"). Within two weeks, the offensive had been repulsed, the Soviets advanced to [Vienna](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vienna_offensive "Vienna offensive"), and captured the city. In early April, Soviet troops [captured Königsberg](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_K%C3%B6nigsberg "Battle of Königsberg"), while the Western Allies finally [pushed forward in Italy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spring_1945_offensive_in_Italy "Spring 1945 offensive in Italy") and swept across western Germany capturing [Hamburg](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Capture_of_Hamburg "Capture of Hamburg") and [Nuremberg](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Nuremberg_(1945) "Battle of Nuremberg (1945)"). [American and Soviet forces met at the Elbe river](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elbe_Day "Elbe Day") on 25 April, leaving unoccupied pockets in southern Germany and around Berlin.

Soviet troops [stormed and captured Berlin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Berlin "Battle of Berlin") in late April.[[294]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEKershaw2001793%E2%80%93829-297) In Italy, [German forces surrendered](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Surrender_of_Caserta "Surrender of Caserta") on 29 April, while the [Italian Social Republic](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Italian_Social_Republic "Italian Social Republic") capitulated two days later. On 30 April, the [Reichstag](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reichstag_building "Reichstag building") was captured, signalling the military defeat of Nazi Germany.[[295]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Shepardson_1998-298)

Major changes in leadership occurred on both sides during this period. On 12 April, President Roosevelt died and was succeeded by his vice president, [Harry S. Truman](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harry_S._Truman "Harry S. Truman").[[296]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-299) Benito Mussolini [was killed](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Death_of_Benito_Mussolini "Death of Benito Mussolini") by [Italian partisans](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Italian_resistance_movement "Italian resistance movement") on 28 April.[[297]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-O'Reilly_2001_244-300) On 30 April, [Hitler committed suicide](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Death_of_Adolf_Hitler "Death of Adolf Hitler") in his [headquarters](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/F%C3%BChrerbunker "Führerbunker"), and was succeeded by [Grand Admiral](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grand_Admiral "Grand Admiral")[Karl Dönitz](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Karl_D%C3%B6nitz "Karl Dönitz") (as [President of the Reich](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_Germany_(1919%E2%80%931945) "President of Germany (1919–1945)")) and [Joseph Goebbels](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joseph_Goebbels "Joseph Goebbels") (as [Chancellor of the Reich](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chancellor_of_the_Reich "Chancellor of the Reich")). Goebbels also committed suicide on the following day and was replaced by [Lutz Graf Schwerin von Krosigk](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lutz_Graf_Schwerin_von_Krosigk "Lutz Graf Schwerin von Krosigk"), in what would later be known as the [Flensburg Government](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flensburg_Government "Flensburg Government"). [Total and unconditional surrender](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/German_Instrument_of_Surrender "German Instrument of Surrender") in Europe was signed [on 7 and 8 May](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Victory_in_Europe_Day "Victory in Europe Day"), to be effective by the end of [8 May](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Victory_Day_(9_May) "Victory Day (9 May)").[[298]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Evans_2008_737-301) German Army Group Centre [resisted in Prague](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prague_offensive "Prague offensive") until 11 May.[[299]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Glantz_1998_34-302) On 23 May all remaining members of the German government were arrested by Allied forces in [Flensburg](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flensburg "Flensburg"). On 5 June all German political and military institutions were placed under Allied control through the [Berlin Declaration](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Berlin_Declaration_(1945) "Berlin Declaration (1945)").[[300]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-303)

In the Pacific theatre, American forces accompanied by the forces of the [Philippine Commonwealth](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Commonwealth_of_the_Philippines "Commonwealth of the Philippines") advanced [in the Philippines](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philippines_campaign_(1944%E2%80%931945) "Philippines campaign (1944–1945)"), [clearing Leyte](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Leyte "Battle of Leyte") by the end of April 1945. They [landed on Luzon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Luzon "Battle of Luzon") in January 1945 and [recaptured Manila](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Manila_(1945) "Battle of Manila (1945)") in March. Fighting continued on Luzon, [Mindanao](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Mindanao "Battle of Mindanao"), and other islands of the Philippines until the [end of the war](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/End_of_World_War_II_in_Asia "End of World War II in Asia").[[301]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-304) Meanwhile, the [United States Army Air Forces](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Army_Air_Forces "United States Army Air Forces") launched [a massive firebombing campaign](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Air_raids_on_Japan "Air raids on Japan") of strategic cities in Japan in an effort to destroy Japanese war industry and civilian morale. A devastating [bombing raid on Tokyo of 9–10 March](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bombing_of_Tokyo "Bombing of Tokyo") was the deadliest conventional bombing raid in history.[[302]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-305)

[![Image 41](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/94/Mamoru_Shigemitsu_signs_the_Instrument_of_Surrender%2C_officially_ending_the_Second_World_War.jpg/250px-Mamoru_Shigemitsu_signs_the_Instrument_of_Surrender%2C_officially_ending_the_Second_World_War.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Mamoru_Shigemitsu_signs_the_Instrument_of_Surrender,_officially_ending_the_Second_World_War.jpg)

Japanese foreign affairs minister [Mamoru Shigemitsu](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mamoru_Shigemitsu "Mamoru Shigemitsu") signs the [Japanese Instrument of Surrender](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_Instrument_of_Surrender "Japanese Instrument of Surrender") on board [USS _Missouri_](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Missouri_(BB-63) "USS Missouri (BB-63)"), 2 September 1945

In May 1945, Australian troops [landed in Borneo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Borneo_campaign "Borneo campaign"), overrunning the oilfields there. British, American, and Chinese forces defeated the Japanese in northern [Burma](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Burma_campaign "Burma campaign") in March, and the British pushed on to reach [Rangoon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yangon "Yangon") by 3 May.[[303]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Drea_2003_57-306) Chinese forces started a counterattack in the [Battle of West Hunan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_West_Hunan "Battle of West Hunan") that occurred between 6 April and 7 June 1945. American naval and amphibious forces also moved towards Japan, taking [Iwo Jima](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Iwo_Jima "Battle of Iwo Jima") by March, and [Okinawa](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Okinawa "Battle of Okinawa") by the end of June.[[304]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-307) At the same time, a naval blockade by [submarines](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Allied_submarines_in_the_Pacific_War "Allied submarines in the Pacific War") was strangling Japan's economy and drastically reducing its ability to supply overseas forces.[[305]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-results_of_german_and_american_submarines-308)[[306]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-309)

On 11 July, Allied leaders [met in Potsdam, Germany](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Potsdam_Conference "Potsdam Conference"). They [confirmed earlier agreements](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Potsdam_Agreement "Potsdam Agreement") about Germany,[[307]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Williams_2006_90-310) and the American, British and Chinese governments reiterated the demand for unconditional surrender of Japan, specifically stating that "[the alternative for Japan is prompt and utter destruction](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Potsdam_Declaration "Potsdam Declaration")".[[308]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Miscamble_2007_201-311) During this conference, the United Kingdom [held its general election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1945_United_Kingdom_general_election "1945 United Kingdom general election"), and [Clement Attlee](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clement_Attlee "Clement Attlee") replaced Churchill as Prime Minister.[[309]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Miscamble_2007_203_204-312)

The call for unconditional surrender was rejected by the Japanese government, which believed it would be capable of negotiating for more favourable surrender terms.[[310]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-313) In early August, the United States [dropped atomic bombs](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Atomic_bombings_of_Hiroshima_and_Nagasaki "Atomic bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki") on the Japanese cities of [Hiroshima](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hiroshima "Hiroshima") and [Nagasaki](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nagasaki "Nagasaki"). Between the two bombings, the Soviets, pursuant to the Yalta agreement, [declared war on Japan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soviet%E2%80%93Japanese_War "Soviet–Japanese War"), [invaded Japanese-held Manchuria](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soviet_invasion_of_Manchuria "Soviet invasion of Manchuria") and quickly defeated the [Kwantung Army](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kwantung_Army "Kwantung Army"), which was the largest Japanese fighting force.[[311]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-314) These two events persuaded previously adamant Imperial Army leaders to accept surrender terms.[[312]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Pape_1993-315) The Red Army also captured the [southern part of Sakhalin Island](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soviet_invasion_of_South_Sakhalin "Soviet invasion of South Sakhalin") and the [Kuril Islands](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Invasion_of_the_Kuril_Islands "Invasion of the Kuril Islands"). On the night of 9–10 August 1945, Emperor Hirohito announced his decision to accept the terms demanded by the Allies in the [Potsdam Declaration](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Potsdam_Declaration "Potsdam Declaration").[[313]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBix2000525%E2%80%93526-316) On 15 August, the Emperor communicated this decision to the Japanese people through a speech broadcast on the radio ([_Gyokuon-hōsō_](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hirohito_surrender_broadcast "Hirohito surrender broadcast"), literally "broadcast in the Emperor's voice").[[314]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBix2000526%E2%80%93528-317) On 15 August 1945, [Japan surrendered](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Surrender_of_Japan "Surrender of Japan"), with the [surrender documents](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_Instrument_of_Surrender "Japanese Instrument of Surrender") finally signed at [Tokyo Bay](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tokyo_Bay "Tokyo Bay") on the deck of the American battleship [USS _Missouri_](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Missouri_(BB-63) "USS Missouri (BB-63)") on 2 September 1945, ending the war.[[315]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Beevor_2012_776-318)
