triples.sentence: They [confirmed earlier agreements](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Potsdam_Agreement "Potsdam Agreement") about Germany,[[307]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Williams_2006_90-310) and the American, British and Chinese governments reiterated the demand for unconditional surrender of Japan, specifically stating that "[the alternative for Japan is prompt and utter destruction](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Potsdam_Declaration "Potsdam Declaration")".[[308]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Miscamble_2007_201-311)
triples.statement: At the Potsdam Conference, leaders confirmed previous agreements about Germany, and the American, British, and Chinese governments repeated their demand for Japan's unconditional surrender, warning of "prompt and utter destruction."

triples.sentence: During this conference, the United Kingdom [held its general election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1945_United_Kingdom_general_election "1945 United Kingdom general election"), and [Clement Attlee](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clement_Attlee "Clement Attlee") replaced Churchill as Prime Minister.[[309]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Miscamble_2007_203_204-312)
triples.statement: During the Potsdam Conference, Clement Attlee replaced Winston Churchill as Prime Minister of the United Kingdom following a general election.

triples.sentence: The call for unconditional surrender was rejected by the Japanese government, which believed it would be capable of negotiating for more favourable surrender terms.[[310]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-313)
triples.statement: The Japanese government rejected the call for unconditional surrender, believing it could negotiate better terms.

triples.sentence: Between the two bombings, the Soviets, pursuant to the Yalta agreement, [declared war on Japan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soviet%E2%80%93Japanese_War "Soviet–Japanese War"), [invaded Japanese-held Manchuria](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soviet_invasion_of_Manchuria "Soviet invasion of Manchuria") and quickly defeated the [Kwantung Army](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kwantung_Army "Kwantung Army"), which was the largest Japanese fighting force.[[311]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-314)
triples.statement: Between the atomic bombings, the Soviet Union declared war on Japan, invaded Manchuria, and defeated the Kwantung Army, Japan's largest fighting force.

triples.sentence: These two events persuaded previously adamant Imperial Army leaders to accept surrender terms.[[312]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Pape_1993-315)
triples.statement: The atomic bombings and the Soviet invasion persuaded previously resistant Imperial Army leaders to accept surrender.

triples.sentence: On the night of 9–10 August 1945, Emperor Hirohito announced his decision to accept the terms demanded by the Allies in the [Potsdam Declaration](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Potsdam_Declaration "Potsdam Declaration").[[313]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBix2000525%E2%80%93526-316)
triples.statement: On the night of August 9–10, 1945, Emperor Hirohito announced his decision to accept the terms of the Potsdam Declaration.

triples.sentence: On 15 August, the Emperor communicated this decision to the Japanese people through a speech broadcast on the radio ([_Gyokuon-hōsō_](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hirohito_surrender_broadcast "Hirohito surrender broadcast"), literally "broadcast in the Emperor's voice").[[314]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBix2000526%E2%80%93528-317)
triples.statement: On August 15, the Emperor announced his decision to the Japanese people via a radio broadcast known as the Gyokuon-hōsō.

triples.sentence: On 15 August 1945, [Japan surrendered](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Surrender_of_Japan "Surrender of Japan"), with the [surrender documents](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_Instrument_of_Surrender "Japanese Instrument of Surrender") finally signed at [Tokyo Bay](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tokyo_Bay "Tokyo Bay") on the deck of the American battleship [USS _Missouri_](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Missouri_(BB-63) "USS Missouri (BB-63)") on 2 September 1945, ending the war.[[315]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Beevor_2012_776-318)
triples.statement: Japan surrendered on August 15, 1945, and the formal surrender documents were signed on September 2, 1945, aboard the USS Missouri in Tokyo Bay, officially ending the war.

section_body:
Main articles: [Aftermath of World War II](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aftermath_of_World_War_II "Aftermath of World War II") and [Consequences of Nazism](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Consequences_of_Nazism "Consequences of Nazism")

[![Image 42](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b8/Proces_Neurenberg%2C_Bestanddeelnr_901-2065.jpg/250px-Proces_Neurenberg%2C_Bestanddeelnr_901-2065.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Proces_Neurenberg,_Bestanddeelnr_901-2065.jpg)

Defendants at the [Nuremberg trials](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nuremberg_trials "Nuremberg trials"), where the Allied forces prosecuted prominent members of the political, military, judicial, and economic leadership of [Nazi Germany](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nazi_Germany "Nazi Germany") for [crimes against humanity](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crimes_against_humanity "Crimes against humanity")

The Allies established occupation administrations in [Austria](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Allied-occupied_Austria "Allied-occupied Austria") and [Germany](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Allied-occupied_Germany "Allied-occupied Germany"), both initially divided between western and eastern occupation zones controlled by the Western Allies and the Soviet Union, respectively. However, their paths soon diverged. In Germany, the [western](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trizone "Trizone") and [eastern occupation zones](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soviet_occupation_zone_in_Germany "Soviet occupation zone in Germany") officially ended in 1949, with the respective zones becoming separate countries, [West Germany](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/West_Germany "West Germany") and [East Germany](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/East_Germany "East Germany").[[316]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Wettig_2008_96_100-319) In Austria, however, occupation continued until 1955, when a joint settlement between the Western Allies and the Soviet Union permitted the reunification of Austria as a democratic state officially non-aligned with any political bloc (although in practice having better relations with the Western Allies). A [denazification](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Denazification "Denazification") program in Germany led to the prosecution of Nazi war criminals in the [Nuremberg trials](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nuremberg_trials "Nuremberg trials") and the removal of ex-Nazis from power, although this policy moved towards amnesty and re-integration of ex-Nazis into West German society.[[317]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Frei_2002_41_66-320)

Germany lost a quarter of its pre-war (1937) territory. Among the eastern territories, [Silesia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Silesia "Silesia"), [Neumark](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Neumark "Neumark") and most of [Pomerania](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pomerania "Pomerania") were taken over by Poland,[[318]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Eberhardt-2015-321) and [East Prussia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/East_Prussia "East Prussia") was divided between Poland and the Soviet Union, followed by the [expulsion to Germany](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flight_and_expulsion_of_Germans_(1944%E2%80%931950) "Flight and expulsion of Germans (1944–1950)") of the nine million Germans from these provinces,[[319]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Eberhardt-2006-322)[[320]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Eberhardt-2011-323) as well as three million Germans from the [Sudetenland](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sudetenland "Sudetenland") in Czechoslovakia. By the 1950s, one-fifth of West Germans were refugees from the east. The Soviet Union also took over the Polish provinces east of the [Curzon Line](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Curzon_Line "Curzon Line"),[[321]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Eberhardt-2012-324) from which [two million Poles were expelled](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Polish_population_transfers_(1944%E2%80%931946) "Polish population transfers (1944–1946)").[[320]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Eberhardt-2011-323)[[322]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-stalinswars43-325) North-east Romania,[[323]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-stalinswars55-326)[[324]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-shirer794-327) parts of eastern Finland,[[325]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-ckpipe-328) and the [Baltic states](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Baltic_states "Baltic states") were [annexed into the Soviet Union](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soviet_re-occupation_of_the_Baltic_states_(1944) "Soviet re-occupation of the Baltic states (1944)").[[326]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Wettig_2008_20_21-329)[[327]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Senn_2007_?-330) Italy [lost its monarchy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1946_Italian_institutional_referendum "1946 Italian institutional referendum"), [colonial empire](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Italian_Empire "Italian Empire"), and some [European territories](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Treaty_of_Paris_between_Italy_and_the_Allied_Powers "Treaty of Paris between Italy and the Allied Powers").[[328]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-331)

In an effort to maintain [world peace](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_peace "World peace"),[[329]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Yoder_1997_39-332) the Allies formed the [United Nations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Nations "United Nations"),[[330]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-333) which officially came into existence on 24 October 1945,[[331]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-334) and adopted the [Universal Declaration of Human Rights](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Universal_Declaration_of_Human_Rights "Universal Declaration of Human Rights") in 1948 as a common standard for all [member nations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Member_states_of_the_United_Nations "Member states of the United Nations").[[332]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Waltz_2002-335) The [great powers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Great_powers "Great powers") that were the victors of the war—France, China, the United Kingdom, the Soviet Union, and the United States—became the [permanent members](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Permanent_members_of_the_United_Nations_Security_Council "Permanent members of the United Nations Security Council") of the UN's [Security Council](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Nations_Security_Council "United Nations Security Council").[[333]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-The_UN_Security_Council-336) The five permanent members remain so to the present, although there have been two seat changes, [between](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Nations_General_Assembly_Resolution_2758 "United Nations General Assembly Resolution 2758") the [Republic of China](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Taiwan "Taiwan") and the [People's Republic of China](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China "China") in 1971, and between the Soviet Union and its [successor state](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Succession_of_states "Succession of states"), the [Russian Federation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russia "Russia"), following the [dissolution of the Soviet Union](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dissolution_of_the_Soviet_Union "Dissolution of the Soviet Union") in 1991. The alliance between the Western Allies and the Soviet Union had begun to deteriorate even before the war was over.[[334]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Kantowicz_2000_6-337)

[![Image 43](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/7b/EasternBloc_BorderChange38-48.svg/250px-EasternBloc_BorderChange38-48.svg.png)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:EasternBloc_BorderChange38-48.svg)

Post-war border changes in [Central Europe](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Central_Europe "Central Europe") and creation of the [Communist](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Communism "Communism")[Eastern Bloc](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eastern_Bloc "Eastern Bloc")

Besides Germany, the rest of Europe was also divided into Western and Soviet [spheres of influence](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spheres_of_influence "Spheres of influence").[[335]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Trachtenberg_1999_33-338) Most eastern and central European countries fell into the [Soviet sphere](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eastern_Bloc "Eastern Bloc"), which led to the establishment of Communist-led regimes, with full or partial support of the Soviet occupation authorities. As a result, [East Germany](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/East_Germany "East Germany"),[[336]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Applebaum_2012-339)[Poland](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Polish_People%27s_Republic "Polish People's Republic"), [Hungary](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hungarian_People%27s_Republic "Hungarian People's Republic"), [Romania](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Socialist_Republic_of_Romania "Socialist Republic of Romania"), [Bulgaria](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/People%27s_Republic_of_Bulgaria "People's Republic of Bulgaria"), [Czechoslovakia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Czechoslovak_Socialist_Republic "Czechoslovak Socialist Republic"), and [Albania](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/People%27s_Socialist_Republic_of_Albania "People's Socialist Republic of Albania")[[337]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Naimark_2010-340) became Soviet [satellite states](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Satellite_state#Soviet_satellite_states "Satellite state"). Communist [Yugoslavia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Socialist_Federal_Republic_of_Yugoslavia "Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia") conducted a fully [independent policy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Non-Aligned_Movement "Non-Aligned Movement"), causing [tension with the Soviet Union](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tito%E2%80%93Stalin_split "Tito–Stalin split").[[338]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Swain_1992-341) A [communist uprising in Greece](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Greek_Civil_War "Greek Civil War") was put down with Anglo-American support and the country remained aligned with the West.[[339]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-342)

Post-war division of the world was formalised by two international military alliances, the United States-led [NATO](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NATO "NATO") and the Soviet-led [Warsaw Pact](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Warsaw_Pact "Warsaw Pact").[[340]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Borstelmann_2005_318-343) The long period of political tensions and military competition between them—the [Cold War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cold_War "Cold War")—would be accompanied by an unprecedented [arms race](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arms_race "Arms race") and number of [proxy wars](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Proxy_war "Proxy war") throughout the world.[[341]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-344)

In Asia, the United States led the [occupation of Japan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Occupation_of_Japan "Occupation of Japan") and [administered Japan's former islands](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trust_Territory_of_the_Pacific_Islands "Trust Territory of the Pacific Islands") in the Western Pacific, while the Soviets annexed [South Sakhalin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Sakhalin "South Sakhalin") and the [Kuril Islands](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kuril_Islands "Kuril Islands").[[342]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Weinberg_2005_911-345)[Korea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Korea "Korea"), formerly [under Japanese colonial rule](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Korea_under_Japanese_rule "Korea under Japanese rule"), was [divided and occupied](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Division_of_Korea "Division of Korea") by the Soviet Union in the [North](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/North_Korea "North Korea") and the United States in the [South](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Korea "South Korea") between 1945 and 1948. Separate republics emerged on both sides of the 38th parallel in 1948, each claiming to be the legitimate government for all of Korea, which led ultimately to the [Korean War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Korean_War "Korean War").[[343]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-346)

In China, nationalist and communist forces resumed [the civil war](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chinese_Civil_War "Chinese Civil War") in June 1946. Communist forces prevailed and established the People's Republic of China on the mainland, while nationalist forces retreated to [Taiwan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Taiwan "Taiwan") in 1949.[[344]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Lynch_2010_12_13-347) In the Middle East, the Arab rejection of the [United Nations Partition Plan for Palestine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Nations_Partition_Plan_for_Palestine "United Nations Partition Plan for Palestine") and the [creation of Israel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Creation_of_Israel "Creation of Israel") marked the escalation of the [Arab–Israeli conflict](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arab%E2%80%93Israeli_conflict "Arab–Israeli conflict"). While European powers attempted to retain some or all of their [colonial empires](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Colonial_empire "Colonial empire"), their losses of prestige and resources during the war rendered this unsuccessful, leading to [decolonisation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Decolonization "Decolonization").[[345]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-JMRoberts_1996_589-348)[[346]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-349)

The global economy suffered heavily from the war, although participating nations were affected differently. The United States emerged much richer than any other nation, leading to a [baby boom](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mid-20th_century_baby_boom "Mid-20th century baby boom"), and by 1950 its [gross domestic product](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gross_domestic_product "Gross domestic product") per person was much greater than that of any of the other powers, and it dominated the world economy.[[347]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-350) The Allied occupational authorities pursued a policy of [industrial disarmament in Western Germany](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Allied_plans_for_German_industry_after_World_War_II "Allied plans for German industry after World War II") from 1945 to 1948.[[348]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Balabkins_1964_207-351) Due to international trade interdependencies, this policy led to an economic stagnation in Europe and delayed European recovery from the war for several years.[[349]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-352)[[350]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Balabkins_1964_208,209-353)

At the [Bretton Woods Conference](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bretton_Woods_Conference "Bretton Woods Conference") in July 1944, the Allied nations drew up an economic framework for the post-war world. The agreement created the [International Monetary Fund](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/International_Monetary_Fund "International Monetary Fund") (IMF) and the [International Bank for Reconstruction and Development](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/International_Bank_for_Reconstruction_and_Development "International Bank for Reconstruction and Development") (IBRD), which later became part of the [World Bank Group](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Bank_Group "World Bank Group"). The [Bretton Woods system](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bretton_Woods_system "Bretton Woods system") lasted until 1973.[[351]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-354) Recovery began with the mid-1948 [currency reform in West Germany](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deutsche_Mark "Deutsche Mark"), and was sped up by the liberalisation of European economic policy that the US [Marshall Plan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marshall_Plan "Marshall Plan") economic aid (1948–1951) both directly and indirectly caused.[[352]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-355)[[353]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Balabkins_1964_212-356) The post-1948 West German recovery has been called the [German economic miracle](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wirtschaftswunder#West_Germany "Wirtschaftswunder").[[354]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-357) Italy also experienced an [economic boom](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Italian_economic_miracle "Italian economic miracle")[[355]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-358) and the [French economy rebounded](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trente_Glorieuses "Trente Glorieuses").[[356]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-359) By contrast, the United Kingdom was in a state of economic ruin,[[357]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-360) and although receiving a quarter of the total Marshall Plan assistance, more than any other European country,[[358]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-361) it continued in relative economic decline for decades.[[359]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-362) The Soviet Union, despite enormous human and material losses, also experienced rapid increases in production in the immediate post-war era,[[360]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Smith_1993_32-363) having seized and transferred most of Germany's industrial plants and exacted [war reparations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II_reparations "World War II reparations") from its satellite states.[[d]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-364)[[361]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-365) Japan recovered much later.[[362]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-366) China returned to its pre-war industrial production by 1952.[[363]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-367)

triples.sentence: Besides Germany, the rest of Europe was also divided into Western and Soviet [spheres of influence](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spheres_of_influence "Spheres of influence").[[335]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Trachtenberg_1999_33-338)
triples.statement: The rest of Europe, in addition to Germany, was divided into Western and Soviet spheres of influence.

triples.sentence: As a result, [East Germany](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/East_Germany "East Germany"),[[336]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Applebaum_2012-339)[Poland](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Polish_People%27s_Republic "Polish People's Republic"), [Hungary](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hungarian_People%27s_Republic "Hungarian People's Republic"), [Romania](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Socialist_Republic_of_Romania "Socialist Republic of Romania"), [Bulgaria](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/People%27s_Republic_of_Bulgaria "People's Republic of Bulgaria"), [Czechoslovakia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Czechoslovak_Socialist_Republic "Czechoslovak Socialist Republic"), and [Albania](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/People%27s_Socialist_Republic_of_Albania "People's Socialist Republic of Albania")[[337]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Naimark_2010-340) became Soviet [satellite states](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Satellite_state#Soviet_satellite_states "Satellite state").
triples.statement: East Germany, Poland, Hungary, Romania, Bulgaria, Czechoslovakia, and Albania became Soviet satellite states.

triples.sentence: Communist [Yugoslavia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Socialist_Federal_Republic_of_Yugoslavia "Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia") conducted a fully [independent policy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Non-Aligned_Movement "Non-Aligned Movement"), causing [tension with the Soviet Union](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tito%E2%80%93Stalin_split "Tito–Stalin split").[[338]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Swain_1992-341)
triples.statement: Communist Yugoslavia pursued an independent policy, which created tension with the Soviet Union.

triples.sentence: Post-war division of the world was formalised by two international military alliances, the United States-led [NATO](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NATO "NATO") and the Soviet-led [Warsaw Pact](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Warsaw_Pact "Warsaw Pact").[[340]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Borstelmann_2005_318-343)
triples.statement: The post-war global division was formalized by two military alliances: the US-led NATO and the Soviet-led Warsaw Pact.

triples.sentence: The long period of political tensions and military competition between them—the [Cold War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cold_War "Cold War")—would be accompanied by an unprecedented [arms race](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arms_race "Arms race") and number of [proxy wars](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Proxy_war "Proxy war") throughout the world.[[341]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-344)
triples.statement: The ensuing period of tension and competition, known as the Cold War, involved a significant arms race and numerous proxy wars globally.

triples.sentence: In Asia, the United States led the [occupation of Japan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Occupation_of_Japan "Occupation of Japan") and [administered Japan's former islands](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trust_Territory_of_the_Pacific_Islands "Trust Territory of the Pacific Islands") in the Western Pacific, while the Soviets annexed [South Sakhalin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Sakhalin "South Sakhalin") and the [Kuril Islands](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kuril_Islands "Kuril Islands").[[342]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Weinberg_2005_911-345)
triples.statement: In Asia, the U.S. occupied Japan and administered its former islands in the Western Pacific, while the Soviets annexed South Sakhalin and the Kuril Islands.

triples.sentence: Separate republics emerged on both sides of the 38th parallel in 1948, each claiming to be the legitimate government for all of Korea, which led ultimately to the [Korean War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Korean_War "Korean War").[[343]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-346)
triples.statement: In 1948, separate republics were established on both sides of the 38th parallel, with each claiming legitimacy over all of Korea, eventually leading to the Korean War.

triples.sentence: Communist forces prevailed and established the People's Republic of China on the mainland, while nationalist forces retreated to [Taiwan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Taiwan "Taiwan") in 1949.[[344]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Lynch_2010_12_13-347)
triples.statement: Communist forces were victorious, establishing the People's Republic of China on the mainland in 1949, while nationalist forces retreated to Taiwan.

triples.sentence: While European powers attempted to retain some or all of their [colonial empires](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Colonial_empire "Colonial empire"), their losses of prestige and resources during the war rendered this unsuccessful, leading to [decolonisation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Decolonization "Decolonization").[[345]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-JMRoberts_1996_589-348)[[346]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-349)
triples.statement: European powers' attempts to retain their colonial empires failed due to losses of prestige and resources during the war, which led to decolonisation.

triples.sentence: The United States emerged much richer than any other nation, leading to a [baby boom](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mid-20th_century_baby_boom "Mid-20th century baby boom"), and by 1950 its [gross domestic product](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gross_domestic_product "Gross domestic product") per person was much greater than that of any of the other powers, and it dominated the world economy.[[347]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-350)
triples.statement: The United States became much wealthier than other nations, experienced a baby boom, and by 1950 had a much higher GDP per person, dominating the world economy.

triples.sentence: The Allied occupational authorities pursued a policy of [industrial disarmament in Western Germany](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Allied_plans_for_German_industry_after_World_War_II "Allied plans for German industry after World War II") from 1945 to 1948.[[348]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Balabkins_1964_207-351)
triples.statement: From 1945 to 1948, Allied occupational authorities implemented a policy of industrial disarmament in Western Germany.

triples.sentence: Due to international trade interdependencies, this policy led to an economic stagnation in Europe and delayed European recovery from the war for several years.[[349]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-352)[[350]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Balabkins_1964_208,209-353)
triples.statement: This policy of industrial disarmament caused economic stagnation in Europe and delayed post-war recovery for several years due to trade interdependencies.

triples.sentence: Recovery began with the mid-1948 [currency reform in West Germany](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deutsche_Mark "Deutsche Mark"), and was sped up by the liberalisation of European economic policy that the US [Marshall Plan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marshall_Plan "Marshall Plan") economic aid (1948–1951) both directly and indirectly caused.[[352]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-355)[[353]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Balabkins_1964_212-356)
triples.statement: Economic recovery started with the mid-1948 currency reform in West Germany and was accelerated by the US Marshall Plan (1948–1951), which liberalized European economic policy.

triples.sentence: The post-1948 West German recovery has been called the [German economic miracle](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wirtschaftswunder#West_Germany "Wirtschaftswunder").[[354]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-357)
triples.statement: The recovery of West Germany after 1948 is known as the German economic miracle.

triples.sentence: Italy also experienced an [economic boom](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Italian_economic_miracle "Italian economic miracle")[[355]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-358) and the [French economy rebounded](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trente_Glorieuses "Trente Glorieuses").[[356]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-359)
triples.statement: Italy also had an economic boom, and the French economy rebounded.

triples.sentence: By contrast, the United Kingdom was in a state of economic ruin,[[357]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-360) and although receiving a quarter of the total Marshall Plan assistance, more than any other European country,[[358]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-361) it continued in relative economic decline for decades.[[359]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-362)
triples.statement: In contrast, the United Kingdom's economy was ruined and, despite receiving more Marshall Plan aid than any other European country, it experienced decades of relative economic decline.

triples.sentence: The Soviet Union, despite enormous human and material losses, also experienced rapid increases in production in the immediate post-war era,[[360]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Smith_1993_32-363) having seized and transferred most of Germany's industrial plants and exacted [war reparations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II_reparations "World War II reparations") from its satellite states.[[d]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-364)[[361]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-365)
triples.statement: Despite significant losses, the Soviet Union saw rapid production increases after the war, partly by seizing German industrial plants and demanding war reparations from its satellite states.

triples.sentence: Japan recovered much later.[[362]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-366)
triples.statement: Japan's economic recovery occurred much later.

triples.sentence: China returned to its pre-war industrial production by 1952.[[363]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-367)
triples.statement: By 1952, China's industrial production had returned to pre-war levels.

section_body:
Main article: [World War II casualties](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II_casualties "World War II casualties")

Further information: [War crimes in World War II](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/War_crimes_in_World_War_II "War crimes in World War II")

[![Image 44](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d1/World_War_II_Casualties.svg/500px-World_War_II_Casualties.svg.png)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:World_War_II_Casualties.svg)

World War II deaths

Estimates for the total number of casualties in the war vary, because many deaths went unrecorded.[[364]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-368) Most suggest 60 million people died, about [20 million military personnel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_casualties_of_World_War_II "Battle casualties of World War II") and 40 million civilians.[[365]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-WWII:_C&C-369)[[366]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-370)

The Soviet Union alone lost around 27 million people during the war,[[367]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-371) including 8.7 million military and 19 million civilian deaths.[[368]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Ell&Mak_1994-372) A quarter of the total people in the Soviet Union were wounded or killed.[[369]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-373) Germany sustained 5.3 million military losses, mostly on the Eastern Front and during the final battles in Germany.[[370]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Herf_2003-374)

An estimated 11[[371]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-375) to 17 million[[372]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Niewyk45-376) civilians died as a direct or as an indirect result of Hitler's [racist policies](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Racial_policy_of_Nazi_Germany "Racial policy of Nazi Germany"), including [mass killing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mass_killing "Mass killing") of [around 6 million Jews](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Holocaust "The Holocaust"), along with [Roma](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Romani_Holocaust "Romani Holocaust"), [homosexuals](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Persecution_of_homosexuals_in_Nazi_Germany "Persecution of homosexuals in Nazi Germany"), at least 1.9 million ethnic [Poles](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II_casualties_of_Poland "World War II casualties of Poland")[[373]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-377)[[374]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-378) and [millions of other Slavs](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II_casualties_of_the_Soviet_Union "World War II casualties of the Soviet Union") (including Russians, Ukrainians and Belarusians), and [other ethnic and minority groups](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Holocaust_victims "Holocaust victims").[[375]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-379)[[372]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Niewyk45-376) Between 1941 and 1945, more than 200,000 ethnic [Serbs](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Serbs "Serbs"), along with Roma and Jews, were [persecuted and murdered](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Genocide_of_Serbs_in_the_Independent_State_of_Croatia "Genocide of Serbs in the Independent State of Croatia") by the Axis-aligned Croatian [Ustaše](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Usta%C5%A1e "Ustaše") in [Yugoslavia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yugoslavia "Yugoslavia").[[376]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-380) Concurrently, [Muslims](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bosniaks "Bosniaks") and [Croats](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Croats "Croats") were [persecuted and killed](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chetnik_war_crimes_in_World_War_II "Chetnik war crimes in World War II") by Serb nationalist [Chetniks](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chetniks "Chetniks"),[[377]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-381) with an estimated 50,000–68,000 victims (of which 41,000 were civilians).[[378]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Geiger-382) Also, more than 100,000 Poles were massacred by the [Ukrainian Insurgent Army](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ukrainian_Insurgent_Army "Ukrainian Insurgent Army") in the [Volhynia massacres](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Massacres_of_Poles_in_Volhynia_and_Eastern_Galicia "Massacres of Poles in Volhynia and Eastern Galicia"), between 1943 and 1945.[[379]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-383) At the same time, about 10,000–15,000 Ukrainians were killed by the Polish [Home Army](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Home_Army "Home Army") and other Polish units, in reprisal attacks.[[380]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-384)

[![Image 45](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/72/Nanking_bodies_1937.jpg/250px-Nanking_bodies_1937.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Nanking_bodies_1937.jpg)

Bodies of Chinese civilians killed by the [Imperial Japanese Army](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Imperial_Japanese_Army "Imperial Japanese Army") during the [Nanjing Massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nanjing_Massacre "Nanjing Massacre") in December 1937

In Asia and the Pacific, the number of people killed by Japanese troops remains contested. According to R.J. Rummel, the Japanese killed between 3 million and more than 10 million people, with the most probable case of almost 6,000,000 people.[[381]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-385) According to the British historian [M. R. D. Foot](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/M._R._D._Foot "M. R. D. Foot"), civilian deaths are between 10 million and 20 million, whereas Chinese military casualties (killed and wounded) are estimated to be over five million.[[382]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-386) Other estimates say that up to 30 million people, most of them civilians, were killed.[[383]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-387)[[384]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-388) The most infamous Japanese atrocity was the [Nanjing Massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nanjing_Massacre "Nanjing Massacre"), in which fifty to three hundred thousand Chinese civilians were raped and murdered.[[385]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-389) Mitsuyoshi Himeta reported that 2.47 million casualties occurred during the [Three Alls policy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Three_Alls_policy "Three Alls policy"). General [Yasuji Okamura](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yasuji_Okamura "Yasuji Okamura") implemented the policy in [Hebei](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hebei "Hebei") and [Shandong](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shandong "Shandong").[[386]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-390)

Axis forces employed [biological](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Biological_warfare "Biological warfare") and [chemical weapons](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chemical_warfare "Chemical warfare"). The [Imperial Japanese Army](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Imperial_Japanese_Army "Imperial Japanese Army") used a variety of such weapons during its [invasion and occupation of China](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Second_Sino-Japanese_War "Second Sino-Japanese War") (_see [Unit 731](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unit\_731 "Unit 731")_)[[387]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-391)[[388]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-392) and in [early conflicts against the Soviets](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battles_of_Khalkhin_Gol "Battles of Khalkhin Gol").[[389]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-393) Both the Germans and the [Japanese tested](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_human_experimentation_on_the_Chinese "Japanese human experimentation on the Chinese") such weapons against civilians,[[390]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-394) and sometimes on [prisoners of war](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prisoner_of_war "Prisoner of war").[[391]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-395)

The Soviet Union was responsible for the [Katyn massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Katyn_massacre "Katyn massacre") of 22,000 Polish officers,[[392]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-396) and the imprisonment or execution of [hundreds of thousands of political prisoners](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NKVD_prisoner_massacres "NKVD prisoner massacres") by the [NKVD](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NKVD "NKVD") secret police, along with [mass civilian deportations to Siberia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Population_transfer_in_the_Soviet_Union "Population transfer in the Soviet Union"), in the [Baltic states](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Occupation_of_the_Baltic_states "Occupation of the Baltic states") and [eastern Poland](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Territories_of_Poland_annexed_by_the_Soviet_Union "Territories of Poland annexed by the Soviet Union") annexed by the Red Army.[[393]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-397) Soviet soldiers committed mass rapes in occupied territories, especially [in Germany](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soviet_occupation_zone_in_Germany "Soviet occupation zone in Germany").[[394]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-398)[[395]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Bird-399) The exact number of German women and girls raped by Soviet troops during the war and occupation is uncertain, but historians estimate their numbers are likely in the hundreds of thousands, and possibly as many as two million,[[396]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-:4-400) while figures for women raped by German soldiers in the Soviet Union go as far as ten million.[[397]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-401)[[398]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-402)

The mass bombing of cities in Europe and Asia has often been called a war crime, although no [positive](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Positive_law "Positive law") or specific [customary](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Customary_international_law "Customary international law")[international humanitarian law](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/International_humanitarian_law "International humanitarian law") with respect to [aerial warfare](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aerial_warfare "Aerial warfare") existed before or during World War II.[[399]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-403) The USAAF [bombed a total of 67 Japanese cities](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Air_raids_on_Japan "Air raids on Japan"), killing 393,000 civilians, including the [atomic bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Atomic_bombings_of_Hiroshima_and_Nagasaki "Atomic bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki"), and destroying 65% of built-up areas.[[400]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-404)

triples.statement: Other estimates suggest that up to 30 million people, mostly civilians, were killed.

triples.sentence: The most infamous Japanese atrocity was the [Nanjing Massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nanjing_Massacre "Nanjing Massacre"), in which fifty to three hundred thousand Chinese civilians were raped and murdered.[[385]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-389)
triples.statement: The Nanjing Massacre was the most infamous Japanese atrocity, where fifty to three hundred thousand Chinese civilians were raped and murdered.

triples.sentence: General [Yasuji Okamura](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yasuji_Okamura "Yasuji Okamura") implemented the policy in [Hebei](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hebei "Hebei") and [Shandong](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shandong "Shandong").[[386]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-390)
triples.statement: General Yasuji Okamura implemented the policy in Hebei and Shandong.

triples.sentence: The [Imperial Japanese Army](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Imperial_Japanese_Army "Imperial Japanese Army") used a variety of such weapons during its [invasion and occupation of China](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Second_Sino-Japanese_War "Second Sino-Japanese War") (_see [Unit 731](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unit_731 "Unit 731")_)[[387]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-391)[[388]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-392) and in [early conflicts against the Soviets](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battles_of_Khalkhin_Gol "Battles of Khalkhin Gol").[[389]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-393)
triples.statement: The Imperial Japanese Army used a variety of biological and chemical weapons during its invasion and occupation of China and in early conflicts against the Soviets.

triples.sentence: Both the Germans and the [Japanese tested](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_human_experimentation_on_the_Chinese "Japanese human experimentation on the Chinese") such weapons against civilians,[[390]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-394) and sometimes on [prisoners of war](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prisoner_of_war "Prisoner of war").[[391]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-395)
triples.statement: Both the Germans and the Japanese tested such weapons on civilians and sometimes on prisoners of war.

triples.sentence: The Soviet Union was responsible for the [Katyn massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Katyn_massacre "Katyn massacre") of 22,000 Polish officers,[[392]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-396) and the imprisonment or execution of [hundreds of thousands of political prisoners](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NKVD_prisoner_massacres "NKVD prisoner massacres") by the [NKVD](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NKVD "NKVD") secret police, along with [mass civilian deportations to Siberia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Population_transfer_in_the_Soviet_Union "Population transfer in the Soviet Union"), in the [Baltic states](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Occupation_of_the_Baltic_states "Occupation of the Baltic states") and [eastern Poland](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Territories_of_Poland_annexed_by_the_Soviet_Union "Territories of Poland annexed by the Soviet Union") annexed by the Red Army.[[393]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-397)
triples.statement: The Soviet Union was responsible for the Katyn massacre of 22,000 Polish officers, the imprisonment or execution of hundreds of thousands of political prisoners by the NKVD, and mass civilian deportations to Siberia from the Baltic states and eastern Poland.

triples.sentence: Soviet soldiers committed mass rapes in occupied territories, especially [in Germany](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soviet_occupation_zone_in_Germany "Soviet occupation zone in Germany").[[394]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-398)[[395]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Bird-399)
triples.statement: Soviet soldiers committed mass rapes in occupied territories, especially in Germany.

triples.sentence: The exact number of German women and girls raped by Soviet troops during the war and occupation is uncertain, but historians estimate their numbers are likely in the hundreds of thousands, and possibly as many as two million,[[396]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-:4-400) while figures for women raped by German soldiers in the Soviet Union go as far as ten million.[[397]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-401)[[398]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-402)
triples.statement: While the exact number is uncertain, historians estimate that hundreds of thousands to as many as two million German women and girls were raped by Soviet troops, whereas figures for women raped by German soldiers in the Soviet Union reach as high as ten million.

triples.sentence: The mass bombing of cities in Europe and Asia has often been called a war crime, although no [positive](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Positive_law "Positive law") or specific [customary](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Customary_international_law "Customary international law")[international humanitarian law](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/International_humanitarian_law "International humanitarian law") with respect to [aerial warfare](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aerial_warfare "Aerial warfare") existed before or during World War II.[[399]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-403)
triples.statement: The mass bombing of cities in Europe and Asia has often been called a war crime, though no positive or specific customary international humanitarian law regarding aerial warfare existed before or during World War II.

section_body:
Main articles: [The Holocaust](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Holocaust "The Holocaust"), [Nazi concentration camps](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nazi_concentration_camps "Nazi concentration camps"), [Extermination camp](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Extermination_camp "Extermination camp"), [Forced labour under German rule during World War II](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Forced_labour_under_German_rule_during_World_War_II "Forced labour under German rule during World War II"), [Kidnapping of children by Nazi Germany](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kidnapping_of_children_by_Nazi_Germany "Kidnapping of children by Nazi Germany"), [Nazi human experimentation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nazi_human_experimentation "Nazi human experimentation"), [Soviet war crimes §World War II](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soviet_war_crimes#World_War_II "Soviet war crimes"), [Japanese war crimes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_war_crimes "Japanese war crimes"), and [Prisoners of war in World War II](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prisoners_of_war_in_World_War_II "Prisoners of war in World War II")

[![Image 46](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/7a/The_Liberation_of_Bergen-belsen_Concentration_Camp%2C_April_1945_BU4031.jpg/250px-The_Liberation_of_Bergen-belsen_Concentration_Camp%2C_April_1945_BU4031.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:The_Liberation_of_Bergen-belsen_Concentration_Camp,_April_1945_BU4031.jpg)

[Schutzstaffel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Schutzstaffel "Schutzstaffel") (SS) female camp guards removing prisoners' bodies from lorries and carrying them to a mass grave, inside the German [Bergen-Belsen concentration camp](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bergen-Belsen_concentration_camp "Bergen-Belsen concentration camp"), 1945

[Nazi Germany](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nazi_Germany "Nazi Germany"), under the [dictatorship](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dictatorship "Dictatorship") of Adolf Hitler, was responsible for murdering about 6 million Jews in what is now known as [the Holocaust](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Holocaust "The Holocaust"). They also murdered an additional 4 million others who were deemed "[unworthy of life](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Life_unworthy_of_life "Life unworthy of life")" (including the [disabled](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Disability "Disability") and [mentally ill](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mental_disorder "Mental disorder"), [Soviet prisoners of war](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/German_atrocities_committed_against_Soviet_prisoners_of_war "German atrocities committed against Soviet prisoners of war"), [Romani](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Romani_people "Romani people"), [homosexuals](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Homosexuals "Homosexuals"), [Freemasons](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Freemasons "Freemasons"), and [Jehovah's Witnesses](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jehovah%27s_Witnesses "Jehovah's Witnesses")) as part of a program of deliberate extermination, in effect becoming a "[genocidal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Genocide "Genocide") state".[[401]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-405)[Soviet POWs were kept in especially unbearable conditions](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/German_atrocities_committed_against_Soviet_prisoners_of_war "German atrocities committed against Soviet prisoners of war"), and 3.6 million Soviet POWs out of 5.7 million died in Nazi camps during the war.[[402]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-406)[[403]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Overy_2004_568_569-407) In addition to [concentration camps](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nazi_concentration_camps "Nazi concentration camps"), [death camps](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Extermination_camp "Extermination camp") were created in Nazi Germany to exterminate people on an industrial scale. Nazi Germany extensively used [forced labourers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Forced_labour_under_German_rule_during_World_War_II "Forced labour under German rule during World War II"); about 12 million [Europeans](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ostarbeiter "Ostarbeiter") from German-occupied countries were abducted and used as a slave work force in German industry, agriculture and war economy.[[404]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-compensation-408)

[![Image 47](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/26/Czeslawa_Kwoka_-_Brasse.jpg/250px-Czeslawa_Kwoka_-_Brasse.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Czeslawa_Kwoka_-_Brasse.jpg)

[Prisoner identity photograph of a Polish girl](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Czes%C5%82awa_Kwoka "Czesława Kwoka") taken by the German [SS](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SS "SS") in [Auschwitz](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Auschwitz "Auschwitz").[[405]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-409) Approximately 230,000 children were held prisoner and used in forced labour and [Nazi medical experiments](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nazi_human_experimentation "Nazi human experimentation")

The Soviet [Gulag](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gulag "Gulag") became a _de facto_ system of deadly camps during 1942–1943, when wartime privation and hunger caused numerous deaths of inmates,[[406]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-410) including foreign citizens of Poland and [other countries](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Occupation_of_the_Baltic_states "Occupation of the Baltic states") occupied in 1939–1940 by the Soviet Union, as well as Axis [POWs](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/German_prisoners_of_war_in_the_Soviet_Union "German prisoners of war in the Soviet Union").[[407]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-411) By the end of the war, most Soviet POWs liberated from Nazi camps and many repatriated civilians were detained in special filtration camps where they were subjected to [NKVD](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NKVD "NKVD") evaluation, and 226,127 were sent to the Gulag as real or perceived Nazi collaborators.[[408]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-412)

Japanese [prisoner-of-war camps](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prisoner-of-war_camp "Prisoner-of-war camp"), many of which were used as labour camps, also had high death rates. The [International Military Tribunal for the Far East](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/International_Military_Tribunal_for_the_Far_East "International Military Tribunal for the Far East") found the death rate of [Western prisoners](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Allied_prisoners_of_war_of_Japan "Allied prisoners of war of Japan") was 27 percent (for American POWs, 37 percent),[[409]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-413) seven times that of POWs under the Germans and Italians.[[410]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-414) While 37,583 prisoners from the UK, 28,500 from the Netherlands, and 14,473 from the United States were released after the [surrender of Japan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Surrender_of_Japan "Surrender of Japan"), the number of Chinese released was only 56.[[411]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-415)

At least five million Chinese civilians from northern China and Manchukuo were enslaved between 1935 and 1941 by the [East Asia Development Board](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/East_Asia_Development_Board "East Asia Development Board"), or _Kōain_, for work in mines and war industries. After 1942, the number reached 10 million.[[412]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-zhifen2002-416) In [Java](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java "Java"), between 4 and 10 million _[rōmusha](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/R%C5%8Dmusha "Rōmusha")_ (Japanese: "manual labourers"), were forced to work by the Japanese military. About 270,000 of these Javanese labourers were sent to other Japanese-held areas in Southeast Asia, and only 52,000 were repatriated to Java.[[413]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-indonesiaww2-417)

triples.statement: The Nazis also murdered an additional 4 million people deemed "unworthy of life"—including the disabled, mentally ill, Soviet prisoners of war, Romani people, homosexuals, Freemasons, and Jehovah's Witnesses—as part of a deliberate extermination program.

triples.statement: Due to especially unbearable conditions, 3.6 million out of 5.7 million Soviet POWs died in Nazi camps during the war.

triples.statement: During 1942–1943, the Soviet Gulag became a de facto system of deadly camps where wartime privation and hunger led to numerous deaths of inmates, including foreign citizens from Poland and other countries occupied by the Soviet Union, as well as Axis POWs.

section_body:
Main articles: [German-occupied Europe](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/German-occupied_Europe "German-occupied Europe"), [Resistance during World War II](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Resistance_during_World_War_II "Resistance during World War II"), [Collaboration with Nazi Germany and Fascist Italy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Collaboration_with_Nazi_Germany_and_Fascist_Italy "Collaboration with Nazi Germany and Fascist Italy"), [Collaboration with Imperial Japan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Collaboration_with_Imperial_Japan "Collaboration with Imperial Japan"), and [Nazi plunder](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nazi_plunder "Nazi plunder")

[![Image 48](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/89/Palmiry_before_execution.jpg/250px-Palmiry_before_execution.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Palmiry_before_execution.jpg)

Polish civilians wearing blindfolds photographed just before being massacred by German soldiers in [Palmiry forest](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Palmiry_massacre "Palmiry massacre"), 1940

In Europe, occupation came under two forms. In Western, Northern, and Central Europe (France, Norway, Denmark, the Low Countries, and the [annexed portions of Czechoslovakia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Protectorate_of_Bohemia_and_Moravia "Protectorate of Bohemia and Moravia")) Germany established economic policies through which it collected roughly 69.5 billion reichsmarks (27.8 billion US dollars) by the end of the war; this figure does not include the [plunder](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nazi_plunder "Nazi plunder") of industrial products, military equipment, raw materials and other goods.[[414]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-418) Thus, the income from occupied nations was over 40 percent of the income Germany collected from taxation, a figure which increased to nearly 40 percent of total German income as the war went on.[[415]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Milward_1979_138-419)

[![Image 49](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/81/Bundesarchiv_Bild_101I-031-2436-03A%2C_Russland%2C_Hinrichtung_von_Partisanen_retouched.jpg/250px-Bundesarchiv_Bild_101I-031-2436-03A%2C_Russland%2C_Hinrichtung_von_Partisanen_retouched.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Bundesarchiv_Bild_101I-031-2436-03A,_Russland,_Hinrichtung_von_Partisanen_retouched.jpg)

[Soviet partisans](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soviet_partisans "Soviet partisans") hanged by the German army. The [Russian Academy of Sciences](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Academy_of_Sciences "Russian Academy of Sciences") reported in 1995 that [civilian victims in the Soviet Union](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II_casualties_of_the_Soviet_Union "World War II casualties of the Soviet Union") at German hands totalled 13.7 million dead, twenty percent of the 68 million people in the occupied Soviet Union

In the East, the intended gains of _[Lebensraum](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lebensraum "Lebensraum")_ were never attained as fluctuating front-lines and Soviet [scorched earth](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scorched_earth "Scorched earth") policies denied resources to the German invaders.[[416]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Milward_1992_148-420) Unlike in the West, the [Nazi racial policy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Racial_policy_of_Nazi_Germany "Racial policy of Nazi Germany") encouraged extreme brutality against what it considered to be the "[inferior people](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Untermensch "Untermensch")" of [Slavic](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Slavic_peoples "Slavic peoples") descent; most German advances were thus followed by [mass atrocities and war crimes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Generalplan_Ost "Generalplan Ost").[[417]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-421) The Nazis [killed an estimated 2.8 million ethnic Poles](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nazi_crimes_against_the_Polish_nation "Nazi crimes against the Polish nation") in addition to Polish-Jewish [victims of the Holocaust](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Victims_of_the_Holocaust "Victims of the Holocaust").[[418]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-422) Although by 1942 [resistance groups](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Resistance_during_World_War_II "Resistance during World War II") formed in most occupied territories,[[419]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-423) the assessments of the effectiveness of [Soviet partisans](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soviet_partisans "Soviet partisans")[[420]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-424) and [French Resistance](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/French_Resistance "French Resistance")[[421]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-425) suggests that they did not significantly hamper German operations until late 1943.

In Asia, Japan termed nations under its occupation as being part of the [Greater East Asia Co-Prosperity Sphere](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Greater_East_Asia_Co-Prosperity_Sphere "Greater East Asia Co-Prosperity Sphere"), essentially a Japanese [hegemony](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hegemony "Hegemony") which it claimed was for purposes of liberating colonised peoples.[[422]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-426) Although Japanese forces were sometimes welcomed as liberators from European domination, [Japanese war crimes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_war_crimes "Japanese war crimes") frequently turned local public opinion against them.[[423]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-GSWW6_266-427) During Japan's initial conquest, it captured 4,000,000 barrels (640,000 m 3) of oil (~550,000 tonnes) left behind by retreating Allied forces; and by 1943, was able to get production in the Dutch East Indies up to 50 million barrels (7,900,000 m 3) of oil (~6.8 million tonnes), 76 percent of its 1940 output rate.[[423]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-GSWW6_266-427)

triples.sentence: In Western, Northern, and Central Europe (France, Norway, Denmark, the Low Countries, and the [annexed portions of Czechoslovakia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Protectorate_of_Bohemia_and_Moravia "Protectorate of Bohemia and Moravia")) Germany established economic policies through which it collected roughly 69.5 billion reichsmarks (27.8 billion US dollars) by the end of the war; this figure does not include the [plunder](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nazi_plunder "Nazi plunder") of industrial products, military equipment, raw materials and other goods.[[414]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-418)
triples.statement: In Western, Northern, and Central Europe, Germany collected approximately 69.5 billion reichsmarks through economic policies, a figure that excludes plundered goods.

triples.sentence: Thus, the income from occupied nations was over 40 percent of the income Germany collected from taxation, a figure which increased to nearly 40 percent of total German income as the war went on.[[415]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Milward_1979_138-419)
triples.statement: Income from occupied nations grew to constitute nearly 40 percent of Germany's total income as the war progressed.

triples.sentence: In the East, the intended gains of _[Lebensraum](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lebensraum "Lebensraum")_ were never attained as fluctuating front-lines and Soviet [scorched earth](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scorched_earth "Scorched earth") policies denied resources to the German invaders.[[416]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Milward_1992_148-420)
triples.statement: Germany's 'Lebensraum' objectives in the East were not achieved because shifting front lines and Soviet scorched-earth tactics deprived the invaders of resources.

triples.sentence: Unlike in the West, the [Nazi racial policy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Racial_policy_of_Nazi_Germany "Racial policy of Nazi Germany") encouraged extreme brutality against what it considered to be the "[inferior people](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Untermensch "Untermensch")" of [Slavic](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Slavic_peoples "Slavic peoples") descent; most German advances were thus followed by [mass atrocities and war crimes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Generalplan_Ost "Generalplan Ost").[[417]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-421)
triples.statement: In contrast to the West, Nazi racial policy in the East promoted extreme brutality and mass atrocities against Slavic peoples, who were deemed 'inferior'.

triples.sentence: The Nazis [killed an estimated 2.8 million ethnic Poles](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nazi_crimes_against_the_Polish_nation "Nazi crimes against the Polish nation") in addition to Polish-Jewish [victims of the Holocaust](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Victims_of_the_Holocaust "Victims of the Holocaust").[[418]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-422)
triples.statement: The Nazis killed an estimated 2.8 million ethnic Poles, not including Polish-Jewish victims of the Holocaust.

triples.sentence: Although by 1942 [resistance groups](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Resistance_during_World_War_II "Resistance during World War II") formed in most occupied territories,[[419]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-423) the assessments of the effectiveness of [Soviet partisans](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soviet_partisans "Soviet partisans")[[420]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-424) and [French Resistance](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/French_Resistance "French Resistance")[[421]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-425) suggests that they did not significantly hamper German operations until late 1943.
triples.statement: While resistance groups had formed in most occupied territories by 1942, assessments suggest that Soviet and French partisans did not significantly impede German operations until late 1943.

triples.sentence: In Asia, Japan termed nations under its occupation as being part of the [Greater East Asia Co-Prosperity Sphere](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Greater_East_Asia_Co-Prosperity_Sphere "Greater East Asia Co-Prosperity Sphere"), essentially a Japanese [hegemony](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hegemony "Hegemony") which it claimed was for purposes of liberating colonised peoples.[[422]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-426)
triples.statement: Japan described its occupied territories in Asia as the Greater East Asia Co-Prosperity Sphere, a hegemony it claimed was intended to liberate colonized peoples.

triples.sentence: Although Japanese forces were sometimes welcomed as liberators from European domination, [Japanese war crimes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_war_crimes "Japanese war crimes") frequently turned local public opinion against them.[[423]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-GSWW6_266-427)
triples.statement: Japanese forces were sometimes welcomed as liberators from European rule, but their war crimes often turned local public opinion against them.

triples.sentence: During Japan's initial conquest, it captured 4,000,000 barrels (640,000 m 3) of oil (~550,000 tonnes) left behind by retreating Allied forces; and by 1943, was able to get production in the Dutch East Indies up to 50 million barrels (7,900,000 m 3) of oil (~6.8 million tonnes), 76 percent of its 1940 output rate.[[423]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-GSWW6_266-427)
triples.statement: During its initial conquest, Japan captured 4 million barrels of oil from retreating Allies, and by 1943, it had restored oil production in the Dutch East Indies to 50 million barrels, which was 76% of the 1940 rate.

section_body:
Main articles: [Military production during World War II](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Military_production_during_World_War_II "Military production during World War II") and [Home front during World War II](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Home_front_during_World_War_II "Home front during World War II")

[![Image 50](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/29/World_War_II_Allies_to_Axis_GDP_Ratio.svg/500px-World_War_II_Allies_to_Axis_GDP_Ratio.svg.png)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:World_War_II_Allies_to_Axis_GDP_Ratio.svg)

Allies to Axis GDP ratio throughout the war

In the 1930s, Britain and the United States together controlled almost 75% of world mineral output—essential for projecting military power.[[424]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-428)

In Europe, before the outbreak of the war, the Allies had significant advantages in both population and economics. In 1938, the Western Allies (United Kingdom, France, Poland and the British Dominions) had a 30 percent larger population and a 30 percent higher gross domestic product than the European Axis powers (Germany and Italy); including colonies, the Allies had more than a 5:1 advantage in population and a nearly 2:1 advantage in GDP.[[425]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-6Econ3-429) In Asia at the same time, China had roughly six times the population of Japan but only an 89 percent higher GDP; this reduces to three times the population and only a 38 percent higher GDP if Japanese colonies are included.[[425]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-6Econ3-429)

The United States produced about two-thirds of all munitions used by the Allies in World War II, including warships, transports, warplanes, artillery, tanks, trucks, and ammunition.[[426]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-430) Although the Allies' economic and population advantages were largely mitigated during the initial rapid blitzkrieg attacks of Germany and Japan, they became the decisive factor by 1942, after the United States and Soviet Union joined the Allies and the war evolved into one of [attrition](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Attrition_warfare "Attrition warfare").[[427]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-6Econ2-431) While the Allies' ability to out-produce the Axis was partly due to more access to natural resources, other factors, such as Germany and Japan's reluctance to employ women in the [labour force](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Workforce "Workforce"),[[428]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-432) Allied [strategic bombing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Strategic_bombing_during_World_War_II "Strategic bombing during World War II"),[[429]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-433) and Germany's late shift to a [war economy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/War_economy "War economy")[[430]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-434) contributed significantly. Additionally, neither Germany nor Japan planned to fight a protracted war, and had not equipped themselves to do so.[[431]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-435) To improve their production, Germany and Japan used millions of [slave labourers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Slavery "Slavery");[[432]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-436)[Germany enslaved](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Forced_labour_under_German_rule_during_World_War_II "Forced labour under German rule during World War II") about 12 million people, mostly from Eastern Europe,[[404]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-compensation-408) while [Japan used](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Slavery_in_Japan "Slavery in Japan") more than 18 million people in Far East Asia.[[412]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-zhifen2002-416)[[413]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-indonesiaww2-417)
